whole_unnormalized_body:
Currently we are looking for the candidate for the position of:

Master Data Specialist

Location: Lodz, Poland


Key responsibilities:
  • Performing systems monitoring operations associated with the analysis of defects, system capacity, routing tickets and governance of resolution
  • Processing of incoming requests and coordinating work of multiple parties to ensure timely and effective resolution of master data defects or early indicators of system failures
  • Drives innovation within the organization by championing new ideas
  • Driving Organizational Results and Proactively identifies opportunities to continuously improvement process
  • Ensuring that end users are receiving the appropriate assistance and ensuring high levels of customer service quality
  • Accurately logging all interactions in the ticketing tool
  • Adhering/updating process documentation
  • Effective and high quality communication with clients
  • Interacting with third party vendors for follow-ups on break fix
  • Day to day reporting


Requirements:
  • Willingness to work on non standard hours
  • Fluent English (min. B2 level)
  • Higher education (at least Bachelor degree)
  • Min. 2 years of experience on a similar position
  • Excel in advanced level
  • Experience from other lines of service
  • Customer Orientation
  • Goal orientation and motivation to keep deadlines
  • Application of analytical thinking in day to day operations
  • Strong communication and problem solving skills
  • High level of pro-activeness and independency
  • SAP or VBA or Service Now knowledge would be nice to have

We offer to the candidates:
  • Free taxi to home after 10PM
  • No trial period
  • Opportunity to develop your career
  • Great atmosphere
  • Career in the multinational company
  • Set of social packages to choose from (private kindergarten and nursery, private medical care, sport card, holiday subsidy, Christmas vouchers and tickets for big cultural events in Lodz)

If you are interested in our offer, would like to develop your professional career in Infosys Poland, please do not hesitate to send us your resume.

In this role, you have the opportunity to

Implement and improve the Sales Support Process objectives and the day-to-day management of the sales support process ensuring the consistent supply of high-quality services.

You are responsible for

  • Preparing all needed documents for participation in tenders for the sales force across all Business Units / Business Lines
  • Prepare all needed certificates and declarations to fulfil tender requirements/qualify for tender
  • Create and maintain a total overview of all tenders
  • Set priorities and ensures correct and completeness of tenders within required timeframes
  • Ensure correct and up-to-date quality documentation and coordinate timely alignment in terms of tender-related issues with internal and external stakeholders
  • Coordinate and preparing quotes approval in a dedicated tool

You are a part of

Our Global Competence Center in Łódź, where we centralize our transactional processes. We bring together supporting roles within HR, Finance, Procurement, Customer Service, Supply Chain and other, enabling you to have a career in an international, cross functional environment. Your future colleagues speak 25+ languages and represent 15+ different nationalities, supporting our operations in 50 countries on a daily basis.

The team based in Lodz is responsible for providing support for the sales team in Germany.

To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience

– Fluent in German, good written and verbal communication

– Read & understand (100%) the complete Tender (what customer wants & what is necessary to win the tender)

– Understand the general terms and conditions of the customer, Focus on special conditions (contractual penalties, terms of payment, delivery time etc.)

– Good customer care skills

– Very good business knowledge and time management

– To be able to a have a conversation with customers & Account Managers in German

– Flexible in working time, working under strict deadlines

– Concentrated working and multitasking (several tenders at the same time)

– Work accurate (attention to details) and be on time

– Good organizational skills

– Good computer and keyboard skills (including MS Office)

– Good administrative skills

– Analytical thinking skills

In return, we offer you

The unique combination of a critical and challenging role and a creative and empowering office environment. You will be actively encouraged to make improvements, establish best in class service and have a direct impact on the success of Philips on a daily basis.

  • Annual bonus based on performance achieved
  • Private medical care with option to extend it to family members
  • Benefit System cards
  • Discount for Philips’ products
  • Language courses
  • Relocation package applicable for people moving in from outside of Łódź region
  • Promotion of healthy lifestyle in the office (fruits twice / week in the office, gym, massage chairs, various events)

Why should you join Philips?

Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watching this video.

To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there,you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.

We are looking for candidates for the position of Database Engineer, for our client based in Łódź.

Currently there is option of working 100% remotely.


Responsibilities:

 • You are responsible for deploying and managing both SQL and NoSQL database clusters running on Linux systems 

• Ensuring  that database cluster systems are properly monitored, taking care that the right data is being collected and analyzed in the right way

• Making sure that our backup and restore processes are flawless and can be easily triggered without extra complexity You help bringing Infrastructure as Code to the database environment • Working  on prospecting new database technologies that might serve our purposes and together with the team make them a reality onto our environment 


Requirements:

• 2+ years of experience using MySQL and/or PostgreSQL databases in production environments • Experience with NoSQL database solutions, especially MongoDB and ElasticSearch

 • Experience with various replication topologies, high availability, disaster management, database migration, database optimization and security setup for both SQL and NoSQL environments

• Experience with Python, Bash or other Linux scripting language

• Experience in automation tools such as SaltStack and Ansible

Livingston Research delivers help and support to customers around the world since 2009.

We strive to help students facilitate learning and improve their performance through leading-edge technology, services, and data capabilities.

We build, launch and promote products and services to empower students in countries like US, Australia, UK and many other.

Now we are looking for smart and creative content writers to join our team.

Position involves researching and writing original texts on various topics in English. Depending on the area of interest, you can specialize in book reports, article/movie reviews, and analytical reports in various spheres.

Requirements
  • Fluent English
  • 3rd year of Bachelor program or higher
  • Ability to work at least 10 hours per week or more

Benefits
  • Competitive compensation with performance-based bonuses in USD;
  • Flexible schedule. You decide when and where you’d like to work!
  • No bossing around;
  • You are the boss, you choose the projects you’d like to work on;
  • Ability to combine this job with your current errands;
  • Expert help 24/7 with order-related questions;
  • Personal success manager, who will gladly assist you with non-order related questions.

HOW TO APPLY?

In order to APPLY for the position and join our freelance family, you are to:
  • Go to [span data-href="http://bit.ly/2ZzNqyh"]http://bit.ly/2ZzNqyh[/span]
  • Fill in your account data;
  • Go through a timed English test and show off your ability to produce great content!
Once you successfully pass these short tests, our Recruiting Team Member will get in touch with you within the next 3−4 business days.

Join ABB and work in a team that is dedicated to creating a future where innovative digital technologies allow greater access to cleaner energy.

As a result of dynamic growth of our organization we are currently looking for candidates for the position of Continuous Improvement Leader. Person hired on this position will be responsible for driving sustainable and transformational change in an identified area of the business / operation with demonstrated improvement in Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) across value chain as an integral part of the local Quality and Continuous Improvement function.


Your Responsibilities
  • Working with the leadership team and functional managers on developing strategy deployment action plans and helping coordinate Kaizen funnel to support the deployment.
  • Championing a culture of continuous improvement and waste elimination across the organization using a range of lean methods, processes and tools such as 5S, Value Stream Map-ping, Daily Management, Level Loading etc.
  • Driving optimization of KPIs around Safety, Quality, Delivery, Inventory, and Costs. Driving Lean conversion for the organization and collaborating with internal and external suppliers and customers on overall Lean fulfilment of the value chain.
  • Creating and managing projects across the business to achieve targets. Ensuring effective sustainment of results and supporting problem solving as needed to close gaps to targets.
  • Building continuous improvement capability through training and implementation of various processes, tools and methods. Acting as the expert on Lean, Six Sigma and other improvement methodologies. Combining technical knowledge with people and organizational skills to deliver operational improvements within the defined timeframe.

Your background
  • Higher technical degree.
  • At least 5 years of experience in working on similar position.
  • Six Sigma Black Belt certification.
  • Experience from leading major improvement projects.
  • Fluent written and spoken English & Polish matched with excellent communication and negotiation skills.
  • Excellent ability to guide, coach and mentor others.
  • Strong analytical and systemic problem solving skills.
  • Driving license.

More About Us
Bring your very own sense of pride and purpose as you help us drive forward the Fourth Industrial Revolution – creating a sustainable future for our planet, and your career. Join ABB and harness the power of our diverse global network, as you collaborate with and learn from our world-class teams. Above all, challenge yourself every day. Let’s write the future, together.

It is an exciting time to join ABB Power Grids. ABB and Hitachi have signed an agreement to create a joint venture (JV). By combining ABB Power Grids’ with Hitachi’s complementary strengths, we plan to form a new and stronger global leader in the power sector. ABB Power Grids and Hitachi will have more than 230 years of combined heritage and experience. Together, we will be well-positioned to shape the future of energy, with pioneering technologies, as the partner of choice for enabling a stronger, smarter and greener grid. The transaction is expected to be completed by the first half of 2020, subject to regulatory approvals. Join us on this exciting journey.

We offer:
  • An interesting job in a company promoting innovative and modern technologies.
  • Opportunity for professional development in an international environment and for increasing your abilities and skills in various areas.
  • Employment in a stable company with an established position in the market.
  • Attractive salary based on your professional experience and skills.
  • Good working environment.
To apply for the position, please send your application in English via our page.

We reserve the right to answer only to the chosen candidates.

We kindly ask you to include in the Curriculum Vitae the following passage: “I hereby give consent for my personal data included in my application to be processed for the purposes of the recruitment process under the Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation)”.
“I also consent to processing of my personal data for the purposes of any future recruitment processes”.
Transformers

The Dean of the Faculty of Medicine of the Medical University of Lodz welcomes applications in an open tender for the position of Assistant.

Purpose of role:


The main purpose of the Data Analyst job is designing and building data models around Microsoft Power BI with a focus on performance, efficiency and compliance of end-to-end process metrics of Finance (P2P, O2C, R2R). The Data Analyst works closely with the Europe Finance Services Management Team, Internal Audit and Financial Planning and Analysis Team.



Key Activities:  


      •  Collaborating with Finance management team by generating the quantitative,   competitive processes insights of P2P, O2C, R2R.
      • Providing consultancy on the Business Intelligence processes, practices and technologies to support Finance management decision-making.
      • Designing, building, testing, documenting data models and report solutions using Microsoft Power BI with a focus on performance, efficiency, security and scalability.
      • Analysing and evaluating financial problems, accounting or control issues, drawing conclusions and making appropriate recommendations to support management decision-making.
      • Applying Knowledge of Process Transformation Techniques to develop the solution required.



Skills required:   


      • 3+ years of experience in similar position
      • Extensive experience in creating multifunctional and dynamic dashboards
      • Strong knowledge of Power BI (R or Python would be an asset)
      • Knowledge of data visualization - dashboards design principles
      • Competent finance practitioner with knowledge of SAP and SAP Tables
      • Very good analytical skills, strong communication skills in English


What we offer:


             · Stimulating environment offering ongoing learning opportunities

             · Culture of innovation and inspiration 

             · Market leading salary and generous benefits

             · Creative, diverse and inclusive working environment

Job Description
  • conducting external and internal recruitment processes;
  • daily cooperation with job portals, preparing and posting job advertisements;
  • contacting and cooperating with management team and departments regarding recruitment processes;
  • active cooperation with universities and career offices, organization and participation in job fairs;
  • preparing reports and presentations within recruitment area;
  • organizing trainings and events;

We Offer
  • job agreement;
  • friendly environment and informal atmosphere;
  • posibility to participate in many committees (eg. charity, sport, learning and development, editing employee magazine etc.);
  • benefit package: life insurance, private medical care, Multisport card, PPE plan sponsored by employer;
  • access to employees' cantine, free hot drinks (coffee, tea, chocolate), fruit once a week;
  • attractive localisation and modern office (good connection with public transport);
  • possibility to gain professional experience in an multinational environment;

We Expect From Candidates
  • very good knowledge of English (speaking and writing);
  • min 1 year experience in conducting recruitment processes;
  • good knowledge of MS Office, especially Excel;
  • time management, ability to work under time pressure, flexibility;
  • customer-focus, very good communication skills;
  • knowledge of polish labor law will be an advantage;

UPS believes, that person with potential can learn anything, so we don't expect from you any job experience. The most important for us is your potential, personality and openess for new experiences

position: Technical Support Specialist, IKEA Retail, Łódź
whole_unnormalized_body:
WHO YOU ARE
You see things a little differently. So do we. We believe that what you value is more important than what your CV says. We offer positions that will challenge your skills and let you grow. Come see things a little differently with us.

Who you are:

• general understanding of the end users’ needs, Digital products and platforms,
• general knowledge of relevant technology standards, trends and innovations,
• general knowledge of IT service management, processes and toolsets, procedures and guidelines,
• extensive knowledge of IT policy, guidelines and principles as well as information security and how to use them in daily job tasks,
• basic knowledge of accounting and finance concepts related to the procurement and lifecycle management of IT assets,
• general knowledge of the Digital landscape and how it works for the business,
• general knowledge of the IT Infrastructure standards and environment,
• general knowledge of the IKEA Concept, the IKEA Brand Identity and the IKEA culture & Values,
• act as an IT ambassador with the ability to communicate in a user-friendly way, and you hold the ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a dynamic and fast paced environment as well as to share Digital knowledge and experience with all stakeholders.

WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING DAY TO DAY
• manage the lifecycle of all IT assets within the defined region including maintaining an accurate inventory, maintaining fixed-asset accounting register, preparing budget input, procurement of new hardware and software and implementation and configuration of new assets,
• lead or support on-site project implementation/deployment efforts with regard to implementation of new Digital products, lifecycle refresh of hardware solutions and all technical implementation work related to the build-up of new locations,
• provide 1st and 2nd level hardware and software support for end users at multiple sites within a defined region, and provide remote, after-hours support for business-critical issues, aligned with Central Group Digital service operations framework,
• perform preventive maintenance and routine monitoring to include creation and follow-up of a service,
• schedule for fixed assets, daily and weekly review of all applicable monitoring tools in order to identify and avoid potential business interruptions,
• ensure projects in need of Technical Support receive such support through participation in necessary project teams and actively ensuring necessary preparations and activities are in place for local projects an global deployments,
• provide hands-on basic technical training for onsite support staff and of new hires, including setting up and introducing technical equipment (e.g. laptops),
• provide input on what digital equipment/products might be in risk of downtime and suggest solutions to ensure the business continuity plan is secured and in place for all critical equipment/products,
• coordinate and manage local vendors and local contact points to global vendors regarding support, upgrades, bug reporting, change requests, etc. when needed.

In this role you will report to the Country Service Operations Team Manager.

ABOUT THIS WORK AREA
To be the local business partner responsible for Digital, while working as a seamless part of the global Ingka Group Digital organization. Ensure IKEA Digital products and platforms are delivered with excellence to meet the needs of customers and co-workers in order to enhance the whole IKEA shopping experience.

QUESTIONS AND SUPPORT? LET'S CONNECT!
Learn more and apply on www.ikea.pl/TwojaStronaPracy.

Due to the fact that this position requires specific competences, please attach any file to your application in which you will present us your experience.

WE WANT
• that you would stay with us for a longer time - we provide a contract of employment,
• that you would develop and build your skill with us – together we will create a development path that will suit your needs,
• to ensure the safety of you and your family - we provide medical care, Pension Plan and Accident Insurance,
• to appreciate your achievements,
• to give you the opportunity to choose additional benefits ex. cafeteria programme (including eg. Multisport card) – learn more on www.ikea.pl/TwojaStronaPracy.


The home furnishing market is expected to triple in Poland by 2035 and IKEA is at the forefront of this growth. With strong expansion plans, we are creating opportunities for innovative, forward-thinking individuals who want to develop themselves, people and the business! We grow and we need you!

position: Register Your Interest – Europe, Middle-East and Africa
whole_unnormalized_body:
Interested in joining Tate & Lyle?

The future starts here. Everyone that works for us plays a key role in delivering on our purpose, Improving Lives for Generations. By joining us, you can look forward to working with a team of experts who are passionate about making a difference in the world of food and beverages and other industries like paper, animal feed and personal care. We strive for how we can make a difference in the lives of everyone we positively impact through our ingredients and solutions, community involvement and sustainability commitments.

By Registering Your Interest You Can
  • Create your candidate profile and upload your CV/resume so our team of recruiters can find you when the right role comes up
  • Be matched to new opportunities based on your profile and aspirations
  • View and manage your applications
Thanks for showing an interest in working with us.

whole_unnormalized_body:
We are Signify, the new company name of Philips Lighting, and we light up the world!

There’s a certain kind of energy here. You can feel it. It’s what happens when you create a big impact!

We’re looking for bold people who challenge us. At Signify, you deepen your knowledge and deliver meaningful results. We’ll invest in you, so you can build on your strengths and develop new ones. We value the new ideas that you bring. In return, you get to work with the best people in our industry.

This is the position you’ve been waiting for! Ready for the great leap?

What You’ll Do

You’ll join our Financial team, located in Łódż - Poland, as a Financial Planning & Analysis Intern.

Signify FP&A (Financial Planning & Analysis) is a very exciting place to learn the basics of FP&A analytics and to be part of a highly talented team of international analysts.
  • Support the FP&A analysts on Monthly and Quarterly reports.
  • Support in ADHOC analytics to senior management.
  • Support the FPA team in our headquarter in Amsterdam.
  • Expect the intern to be proactive, have affinity with numbers, more than 100% accurate and a good communicator.
  • Gain professional experience in Finance and learn the basics of FP&A in a multinational environment.

What You’ll Need
  • You are a student in Finance/ Economic or relative fields
  • You have good command of English.
  • You want to join an international company and develop new practical competences in the Financial Planning and Analysis area
  • You have good command of Ms Office, especially excel.
  • Previous internship experience not required, but a nice to have.
  • You are available to work approx. 20-30 hours/week

What You’ll Get In Return…
  • Flexible working hours and home office possibility
  • Connected and ergonomic office with different areas to work as you need
  • Fruits every day!
  • Young and international place of work
  • Lot of internal social events: huddles/ offsites/ caritative actions

There’s a pool of knowledge here which will take you to the next level of growing and developing yourself. Learn from the best and we’ll help you to leverage your career.

Do you want to kickstart your career? Apply now!

  • prace głównie zbrojarskie (budowy to głównie rezydencje i mieszkania w budynkach 3-4 piętra)

Whirlpool Corporation is consistently recognized by Fortune Magazine as one of the World’s Most Admired Companies. Our values are the driving force behind everything we do. Respect, integrity, diversity and inclusion, teamwork and the spirit of winning propel our teams to excellence. We are looking for a talented and internationally oriented professional with a strong focus on achieving the targets, drive the business results and identify opportunities for the processes optimization. Are you passionate about a new interesting challenge within a dynamic and growing company? Join us then!

    • Perform financial, operational and compliance based internal audits worldwide;

Administrator systemów / aplikacji IT


Chcesz podjąć wyzwanie i rozwijać swoją karierę w zespole, który zarządza infrastrukturą informatyczną mBanku? W naszym zespole kładziemy nacisk na usprawnianie działania systemów i aplikacji, pracujemy analitycznie, projektowo, z pasją i zaangażowaniem. Stosujemy dostępne techniki, wspieramy się wzajemnie i wymieniamy wiedzą. Jeśli chcesz na co dzień robić to, co niezbędne do działania systemów i aplikacji, a przy okazji popijać kawę z ludźmi, którzy tworzą mobilny bank– to miejsce jest dla Ciebie!


W tej roli będziesz odpowiedzialna/y za:

  • wdrażanie i utrzymywanie wysokodostępnych aplikacji w oparciu o systemy serwerowe firm Microsoft i RedHat
  • monitoring aplikacji, identyfikację i rozwiązywanie problemów
  • wspieranie i współpracę z zespołem deweloperskim i z departamentami biznesowymi


Brzmi ciekawie? Dołącz do nas!


Szukamy właśnie Ciebie, jeśli:

  • posiadasz wiedzę i doświadczenie:

- w administrowaniu serwerami Windows Server 2012 - 2019

- w administrowaniu serwerami RedHat

- w pracy w środowisku wysokiej dostępności (HA)

- w zarządzaniu klastrami MS SQL

  • znasz:

- narzędzia monitoringu (Zabbix, SCOM, Idera SQL DM, Dynatrace APM, Splunk)

- IIS Web Server

- Powershell, Perl, Python lub inny język skryptowy

  • masz wykształcenie wyższe
  • posługujesz się językiem angielskim w stopniu komunikatywnym
  • dobrze odnajdujesz się w pracy samodzielnej i zespołowej
  • cechuje Cię proaktywna postawa i zaangażowanie w swój rozwój oraz rozwój organizacji


dodatkowym atutem będzie znajomość:

  • systemu IBM MQ
  • baz NoSql (Redis, MongoDB)
  • ElasticSearch, Kibana
  • wiedza nt. konteneryzacji, np: Docker


Nasza oferta: umowa o parcę, zgrany zespół chętnie dzielący się wiedzą, atrakcyjne wynagrodzenie czeka na Ciebie biurko przy ulicy Kilińskiego 74 w Przystanku mBank.

Finance Managerial Trainee

Start: as soon as possible

Work schedule: full time/ part- time with flexible working hours

Duration:6-12 months

We are building the next generation of leaders and leadership brands.

Do you want to join us and dive into global challenges with us? Learn from some of the top tier experts and craft your own unique opportunities while making a difference on the business.

About us:

At Procter & Gamble, we are proud to say that we develop talents almost exclusively from within. This means we are not just offering you your first job out of University; we are hiring you with the expectations you will grow into one of our future leaders - maybe even our next CEO.

We are the world's largest consumer goods company with operations in 80 countries, more than 80 billion US$ in revenues and with 25 Billion-Dollar Brands, such as Gillette®, Ariel®, Pantene® and Oral-B®.

Why to apply - The job scope:

Join the Finance Traineeship Program at P&G Central Europe to get the rare opportunity to work in the best-in-class finance department - a group of passionate leaders working on significant business cases in multinational, fast-changing environment.

Apply for our Finance Traineeship to unleash your potential as:
  • A finance leader and business partner providing finance leadership in business decisions and external interactions (sales/ production engineering)
  • A problem solver with in-depth business and market dynamics understanding, able to analyze data, identify key insights and provide financial acumen to the business
  • A risk taker able to take ownership of big, meaningful projects from Day 1 to transform and streamline the business as well as local and regional operations


As a Finance Trainee, you will:
  • Develop according to your individual training plan
  • Enjoy an attractive salary and compensation package
  • Participate in accelerated On-the-job and classroom training to develop your personal capabilities
  • Be supported in independent decision-making and risk taking
  • Have an opportunity for a managerial role upon successful completion of the program

Desired Skills and Experience



We are looking for:

  • 3rd, 4th or 5th year Students of all faculties with interest in Finance or fresh alumni of Master's degree
  • Strong initiative, problem solving and good interpersonal skills
  • Strong collaboration skills, leadership and real passion for solving problems
  • Time management skills to deliver your work and make even the biggest goals achievable
  • Very good command of English and Polish languages


Would you like to become a finance business partner and enable the team to execute the business strategies among the biggest retailers?

Everything at P&G starts with understanding - understanding our consumers and our employees as we innovate to improve lives now and for generations to come. Our consumers are diverse and our talents - internally - mirror this diversity to best serve it. That is why we’re committed to building a winning culture based on Inclusion. We are committed to providing equal opportunities in employment. We do not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

position: Front-end Engineer at Talent Portal Team
whole_unnormalized_body:
About Toptal

Toptal is a global network of top talent in business, design, and technology that enables companies to scale their teams, on-demand. With $200+ million in annual revenue and over 40% year-over-year growth, Toptal is the largest fully distributed workforce in the world.

We take the best elements of virtual teams and combine them with a support structure that encourages innovation, social interaction, and fun (see this video from The Huffington Post). We see no borders, move at a fast pace, and are never afraid to break the mold.

Position Description

Talent Portal team is responsible for providing the best experience for our talent network who have completed our vetting process and are looking for new opportunities. Our main goal is to ensure every member of our talent network connects with clients timely to meet engagement requirements.

This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere. Due to the remote nature of this role, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship. Resumes and communication must be submitted in English.

Responsibilities
  • We are in the process of migrating to a brand new separate application using state-of-the-art technologies such as GraphQL and React with all the latest bells and whistles. For frontend developers interested in building and having an impact on a product that changes the professional life of many people, this is the team to be.
  • At the same time, our stack uses a solid, large and proven core built using Rails with excellent test coverage and world-class processes including great code reviews and cross-team knowledge-sharing.
  • The culture is set for high-quality software, high-level interaction among teammates. Expect to make meaningful contributions from early on, and to have continuous learning opportunities, technical and interpersonal.
  • Toptal’s Talent Portal Team is organized using Agile best practices. We are a focused and self-contained team with 2 Front-end developers, 4 Back-end developers, Automation QA Engineer, Product Manager, Designer, and a Team Lead.
  • As a fully-distributed company, in fact, the largest in the world, we expect you to be self-reliant, independent, product-oriented but also extremely responsive and communicative, both in written and oral forms. This set of abilities will allow you geographic and time flexibility that is very rare in other work environments.


Requirements
  • 2 years experience developing production-grade React applications
  • 3 years experience developing HTML5 and CSS3
  • Fluency in Agile and Scrum
  • Fluency in automated tests using Jest, React Testing Library and others
  • Working proficiency with GraphQL and Apollo
  • Experience with Styled Components
  • Working proficiency in Ruby on Rails (nice to have)
  • Fluency in CSS pre- and post-processing
  • Fluency in JS frameworks outside the React ecosystem (nice to have)

For Toptal Use Only: #intlenglish, #individualcontributorEurope, #individualcontributorSA

Firma sprzątającą poszukuje Pana do sprzątania terenów zewnetrznych, dbanie o czystość i estetycznosc wyznaczonego terenu.

Usuwanie śmieci, koszenie, grabienie, odśnieżanie, przycinanie drzew, w zależności od pory roku.

Oczekujemy sumiennosci, dokładności, sily fizycznej, mile widziane doświadczenie i prawo jazdy kat. B, Oferujemy pracę na sprzęcie - traktor, zamiatarka, stała pracę, umowa o pracę, premie, dodatki świąteczne.

Szukasz pracy na dłużej lub chcesz jedynie dorobić? Cenisz sobie elastyczny czas pracy i możliwość pogodzenia jej z nauką, życiem prywatnym, etatem? Mamy dla Ciebie idealną ofertę!

Jobman Group Sp. z o.o.

Pracownik magazynu/sortowanie paczek

  • jesteś dyspozycyjny/a i gotowy/a do pracy przy zmianach nocnych
  • potrafisz pracować w zespole
  • nie brakuje Ci chęci do pracy
OFERUJEMY
  • Umowę o pracę tymczasową
  • Pracę od poniedziałku do piątku w godzinach 19:00-2:00 (możliwość pracy do 8 h)

  • Autobus z:
1 Krośniewice ul. Toruńska - Stacja Uzdatniania Wody

2 Krośniewice Pl. Wolności - przystanek autobusowy

3 Krośniewice, ul. Łęczycka - przy Mleczarni

4 Zalesie

5 Ogrodzona

6 Daszyna

7 Topola Królewska

DODATKOWE INFORMACJE

Aplikacje powinny zawierać klauzulę: ’Na podstawie art. 7 ust. 1 RODO oświadczam, iż wyrażam zgodę na przetwarzanie przez administratora, którym jest Jobman Group Sp. z o.o. z siedzibą w Krakowie, ul. Bociana 22a, 31-231 Kraków moich danych osobowych w celu przeprowadzenia procedury rekrutacji na oferowane stanowisko. Mając na względzie, iż oferta dotyczy wykonywania pracy tymczasowej na rzecz pracodawcy użytkownika, którym jest klient Administratora, rozumiem i akceptuję fakt iż celem przeprowadzenia rekrutacji niezbędnym jest udostępnienie moich danych temu pracodawcy użytkownikowi.’

Remote-work is quickly becoming the default option for high-tech jobs. Crossover is the platform for top-paying, full-time, long-term remote work, and now is a great time to get onboard. We are growing rapidly across nearly 50 different job positions.
This listing is for our L1 Customer Support Agent position, but we have found great applicants often have a current title of Support Specialist or similar, so don’t be confused about that difference, we are glad you found us. Hit “Apply” to learn more about this exciting opportunity.

Are you the person that friends and family turn to for help with their technology problems? Are you interested in learning something new every day and mastering new enterprise software products each month?

Crossover consistently 'wows' its customers with the quality of support we provide and is growing at a very exciting pace. Join our front-line support team to see how interesting and challenging we’ve made L1 support using cutting-edge technology and an innovative process.

We’ve learned that the best customer support agents are smart individuals who love to soak up new knowledge and enjoy using their expertise to solve challenging customer problems. The weekly investments we make in our team’s professional development is what drives customer satisfaction as well as our agent happiness.

Key responsibilities:

  • Be online for one of three daily shifts, as part of a team providing 24x7 global support.
  • Take ownership of support incidents and use all available resources and knowledge to resolve them.
  • Consistently improve the quality of your work by internalizing the feedback and coaching you receive from regular reviews of your completed tickets.

Candidate requirements:

  • Ability to communicate confidently with tech-savvy customers using perfect written and spoken English.
  • Familiarity with a range of enterprise software solutions including Sharepoint and SQL and be comfortable in conversations with IT professionals and technical customers.
  • Experience troubleshooting and solving technical problems.
  • Customer advocacy, empathy and keen attention to detail.
  • Nice to have:
  • Experience in a technical support role covering enterprise software products.
  • An education focused on Computer Science, MIS or similar technical disciplines.
  • We believe that the candidates who will succeed in this role come from an array of technical backgrounds and our selection process entails demonstrating that you can become an expert on one of our real products and that you can solve some real problems that our customers have reported in the past. This is a great way to show off your skills while at the same time getting a taste for what the real-work is like.

What you will be doing:

Solving the difficult customer problems that our AI bot was unable to help them with.

Use voice and written communications to ask insightful questions that get to the root cause of the customer’s problem.

Generating solutions using your deep product knowledge and our rich knowledge bases

Spending over 20% of your time learning, improving your ability to support the products you know and expanding the breadth of products you can support.

What you will NOT be doing:

Getting bored answering simple questions for the same product each day.

Working on easy and simple tickets such as resetting passwords.

Specializing on one single product or technology stack.

Working alone and avoiding live customer interaction.

Analyzing, writing or debugging source code.

There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. If you found this interesting, Apply on crossover.com. After applying you will take a few online “screening” assessments to check for a basic fit, and then move on to some real-world written questions. You will also be assigned to one of our recruiting specialists who can answer questions you might have about the process, role, or company, and help you get to the final interview step. We look forward to meeting you!

Crossover Job Code: LJ-3073-PL-Lodz-SupportSpecial.004

Remote-work is quickly becoming the default option for high-tech jobs. Crossover is the platform for top-paying, full-time, long-term remote work, and now is a great time to get onboard. We are growing rapidly across nearly 50 different job positions.
This listing is for our L1 Customer Support Agent position, but we have found great applicants often have a current title of Support Specialist or similar, so don’t be confused about that difference, we are glad you found us. Hit “Apply” to learn more about this exciting opportunity.

Are you the person that friends and family turn to for help with their technology problems? Are you interested in learning something new every day and mastering new enterprise software products each month?

Crossover consistently 'wows' its customers with the quality of support we provide and is growing at a very exciting pace. Join our front-line support team to see how interesting and challenging we’ve made L1 support using cutting-edge technology and an innovative process.

We’ve learned that the best customer support agents are smart individuals who love to soak up new knowledge and enjoy using their expertise to solve challenging customer problems. The weekly investments we make in our team’s professional development is what drives customer satisfaction as well as our agent happiness.

Key responsibilities:

  • Be online for one of three daily shifts, as part of a team providing 24x7 global support.
  • Take ownership of support incidents and use all available resources and knowledge to resolve them.

Dla naszego Klienta poszukujemyLakiernika-bezpośrednie zatrudnienie!

Oferujemy
  • bezpośrednie zatrudnienie w renomowanej firmie produkcyjnej z branży AGD,
  • możliwość przyuczenia do zawodu,
  • umowę o pracę,
  • atrakcyjne wynagrodzenie i system premiowy,
  • kartę OK System, opiekę medyczną i bezpłatną siłownię na terenie firmy.

Do Twoich Zadań Należeć Będzie
  • realizacja procesu lakierowania komponentów,
  • lakierowanie pistoletem pneumatycznym w kabinach lakierniczych,
  • wizualna kontrola jakości przeprowadzonego procesu.

Lokalizacja: Łódź Widzew

Czas na nowe możliwości! Wyślij nam swoje CV, przyjdź na rozmowę i poznaj szczegóły oferty.

Informujemy, że skontaktujemy się z wybranymi kandydatami.

Administratorem Twoich danych osobowych jest Flexidea Spółka z o.o. z siedzibą w Łodzi, ul. Wólczańska 73 lokal 1/1A. Przetwarzamy dane osobowe w celach związanych z rekrutacją na w/w stanowisko. Kontakt w sprawach ochrony danych osobowych pod adresem Inspektora Ochrony Danych: click apply. Szczegółowe informacje o ochronie danych osobowych zgodnie z RODO na stronie: http://flexidea.pl/pl/strony/1

Prosimy o niezamieszczanie w CV szczególnych kategorii danych osobowych*, takich jak dane o niepełnosprawności, dane dotyczące zdrowia, przekonań religijnych. Jednakże w przypadku jeżeli w CV zawarte są dane o których mowa powyżej, obejmujące swym zakresem szczególne kategorie danych osobowych, o których mowa w art. 9 ust. 1 RODO, prosimy o zaznaczenie w formularzu aplikacyjnym: Wyrażam zgodę na przetwarzanie moich danych osobowych zawartych w CV oraz załączonych do niego dokumentach - wymagane jeśli przekazane dane obejmują szczególne kategorie danych, o których mowa w art. 9 ust. 1 RODO. Administrator poinformował mnie, że niniejsza zgoda może być wycofana w każdym czasie, przy czym wycofanie zgody nie wpływa na zgodność z prawem przetwarzania, którego dokonano na podstawie zgody przed jej wycofaniem. Zgodę mogę wycofać poprzez złożenie oświadczenia w siedzibie Administratora.

W przypadku chęci uczestnictwa w kolejnych naborach prowadzonych przez Flexidea sp. z o.o. prosimy o zaznaczeniu w formularzu aplikacyjnym oświadczenia o wyrażeniu zgody na przetwarzanie danych osobowych w celu wykorzystania ich w kolejnych naborach prowadzonych przez Flexidea sp. z o.o. przez okres najbliższych 2 lat. Administrator poinformował mnie, że niniejsza zgoda może być wycofana w każdym czasie, przy czym wycofanie zgody nie wpływa na zgodność z prawem przetwarzania, którego dokonano na podstawie zgody przed jej wycofaniem. Zgodę mogę wycofać poprzez złożenie oświadczenia w siedzibie Administratora.

  • Zgodnie z art. 9 ust. 1 RODO szczególne kategorie danych osobowych to dane osobowe ujawniające pochodzenie rasowe lub etniczne, poglądy polityczne, przekonania religijne lub światopoglądowe, przynależność do związków zawodowych, dane genetyczne, dane biometryczne, dane dotyczące zdrowia, seksualności, orientacji seksualnej.

We are looking for an Administrative Officer to join our team and support our daily office procedures.

A successful Administrative Officer will act as the point of contact for all employees, providing administrative support and managing their queries. Main duties include managing office stock, preparing regular reports (e.g. expenses and office budgets) and organizing company records. If you have previous experience as an Office Administrator or similar administrative role, we’d like to meet you. Our ideal candidate also has a working knowledge of office equipment and office management tools.

Ultimately, you should be able to ensure our administrative activities run smoothly on a daily and long-term basis.

Responsibilities
  • Manage office supplies stock and place orders
  • Prepare regular reports on expenses and office budgets
  • Maintain and update company databases
  • Organize a filing system for important and confidential company documents
  • Answer queries from employees and clients
  • Update office policies as needed
  • Maintain a company calendar and schedule appointments
  • Book meeting rooms as required
  • Distribute and store correspondence (e.g. letters, emails and packages)
  • Prepare reports and presentations with statistical data, as assigned
  • Arrange travel and accommodations
  • Schedule in-house and external events

Requirements
  • Solid knowledge of office procedures
  • Strong organization skills with a problem-solving attitude
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Attention to detail

In this role, you have the opportunity to

Work at Philips and that is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways.

Task And Responsibilities

  • Ensure that all telephone calls from hospitals and private patients are answered efficiently within departmental procedures
  • Log any customer complaints received according to company procedure
  • Ensure information on the customer database is kept up-to-date, i.e. check information when speaking to customers on the phone
  • Provide a professional and efficient service to customers – maintaining a high standard of service, product information and advice while remaining courteous at all times
  • Enter all customer orders, which are placed over a phone in a timely manner, using SAP and other supporting applications
  • Take clear messages for other members of the department and the sales team where necessary, ensuring messages passed on as soon as possible
  • Together with team members continuously implementing improvements through Lean tooling and disciplines

You are a part of

our Global Competence Center in Łódź, where we centralize our business processes. We bring together supporting roles within HR, Finance, Procurement, Customer Service, Supply Chain and other, enabling you to have a career in an international, cross functional environment. Your future colleagues speak 25+ languages and represent 15+ different nationalities, supporting our operations in 50 countries on a daily basis.

You will be part of Sleep and Respiratory Care team within GBS Philips Supply Chain Department supporting UKI market.

To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience

  • Bachelor degree or vocational (MBO) degree with relevant work experience
  • Telephone Customer Service experience
  • Excellent level of English (direct contact with UKI health organizations and private customers)
  • Strong customer service orientation and problem solving skills
  • Knowledge of SAP and/or equivalent ERP systems (would be an advantage)
  • Cultural awareness and pro-active behavior
  • Ability to act as a team player
  • Ability to work 9:00 -17:00 and 10:00 – 18:00

In return, we offer you

The unique combination of a critical and challenging role and a creative and empowering office environment. You will be actively encouraged to make improvements, establish best in class service and have a direct impact on the success of Philips on a daily basis.

  • Annual bonus based on performance achieved
  • Private medical care with option to extend it to family members
  • Benefit System cards
  • Discount for Philips’ products
  • Language courses
  • Relocation package applicable for people moving in from outside of Łódź region
  • Promotion of healthy lifestyle in the office (fruits twice / week in the office, gym, massage chairs, various events)

Finance Managerial Trainee

Start: as soon as possible

Work schedule: full time/ part- time with flexible working hours

Duration:6-12 months

We are building the next generation of leaders and leadership brands.

Do you want to join us and dive into global challenges with us? Learn from some of the top tier experts and craft your own unique opportunities while making a difference on the business.

About us:

At Procter & Gamble, we are proud to say that we develop talents almost exclusively from within. This means we are not just offering you your first job out of University; we are hiring you with the expectations you will grow into one of our future leaders - maybe even our next CEO.

We are the world's largest consumer goods company with operations in 80 countries, more than 80 billion US$ in revenues and with 25 Billion-Dollar Brands, such as Gillette®, Ariel®, Pantene® and Oral-B®.

Why to apply - The job scope:

Join the Finance Traineeship Program at P&G Central Europe to get the rare opportunity to work in the best-in-class finance department - a group of passionate leaders working on significant business cases in multinational, fast-changing environment.

Apply for our Finance Traineeship to unleash your potential as:
  • A finance leader and business partner providing finance leadership in business decisions and external interactions (sales/ production engineering)
  • A problem solver with in-depth business and market dynamics understanding, able to analyze data, identify key insights and provide financial acumen to the business
  • A risk taker able to take ownership of big, meaningful projects from Day 1 to transform and streamline the business as well as local and regional operations


As a Finance Trainee, you will:
  • Develop according to your individual training plan
  • Enjoy an attractive salary and compensation package
  • Participate in accelerated On-the-job and classroom training to develop your personal capabilities
  • Be supported in independent decision-making and risk taking
  • Have an opportunity for a managerial role upon successful completion of the program

Desired Skills and Experience



We are looking for:

  • 3rd, 4th or 5th year Students of all faculties with interest in Finance or fresh alumni of Master's degree
  • Strong initiative, problem solving and good interpersonal skills
  • Strong collaboration skills, leadership and real passion for solving problems
  • Time management skills to deliver your work and make even the biggest goals achievable
  • Very good command of English and Polish languages


Would you like to become a finance business partner and enable the team to execute the business strategies among the biggest retailers?

Everything at P&G starts with understanding - understanding our consumers and our employees as we innovate to improve lives now and for generations to come. Our consumers are diverse and our talents - internally - mirror this diversity to best serve it. That is why we’re committed to building a winning culture based on Inclusion. We do not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

position: Early Talent and University Relations Specialist
whole_unnormalized_body:
The mission of the HR team is to help ABB stand out when it comes to our people - from leadership, performance and talent management to rewards and career opportunity. In all that we do, we seek to create competitive advantage by dedicating resources to attracting, developing and retaining talented individuals who are customer-focused, collaborative, innovative and driven.

You will play a vital role in leading the implementation of Employer Branding activities via internal communications, external careers events, and across digital platforms. Reporting to the Global Head – Early Talent and University Relations, you will work closely with key universities, student associations, and HR professionals, to position ABB as an employer of choice.


Your Responsibilities
  • Supporting the definition, promotion, and evaluation of early talent projects, e.g. graduate trainee programs, internship programs, development programs.
  • Deploying the Employee Value Proposition (EVP) for Early Talents in line with Global directives, customizing to the local market and applying it to all existing activities, communication materials, and channels.
  • Building positive networks with Universities, Students’ associations, and subject specific networks (i.e. engineering associations) identifying their success factors, and positioning ABB as an employer of choice.
  • Collaborating with business leaders, Talent Partners, HR business partners (HRBPs), and third-party event/marketing agencies to support a range of recruitment activities (campaigns, events, career fairs, conferences etc.), ensuring that the EVP is correctly deployed, and service quality meets ABB’s standards.
  • Supporting the on-boarding of early talent, providing guidance throughout their development and promotion within the organization, and maintaining contact with current and past junior ABB alumni.
  • Acting as a Social Media Brand Ambassador - identifying a variety of digital channels through which to communicate ABB’s key messages, while creating and driving content to inspire and engage with early talents.
  • Building a network of skilled colleagues to act as Brand Ambassadors, delivering all required training to represent ABB successfully at a variety of in-person events and via digital channels.
  • Facilitating the effective communication of all Employer Branding initiatives and processes, ensuring that key messages are properly circulated to create awareness and buy-in.
  • Living ABB’s core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business.

Your background
  • A Bachelor or Master’s degree in HR Management, Business, Marketing or Communication.
  • At least 3 years of experience in Employer Branding, University Relations, Recruitment or a related field.
  • Strong working knowledge of digital marketing practices across major Social Media channels.
  • Clear understanding of business priorities, and the ability to apply them in positioning of the employer value proposition with graduates.
  • Excellent relationship building and collaborative capabilities, with a positive outlook and ability to work effectively with a wide range of stakeholders.
  • Knowledge of the local University market and students' associations in the Country/Region.
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with fluency in English, and other local language as required.
  • Self-driven, resilient, energetic, enthusiastic and inclusive; creating or responding constructively to challenging new ideas and inputs.

More About Us
Bring your very own sense of pride and purpose as you help us drive forward the Fourth Industrial Revolution – creating a sustainable future for our planet, and your career. Join ABB and harness the power of our diverse global network, as you collaborate with and learn from our world-class teams. Above all, challenge yourself every day. Let’s write the future, together.

We offer:
  • An interesting job in a company promoting innovative and modern technologies.
  • Opportunity for professional development in an international environment and for increasing your abilities and skills in various areas.
  • Employment in a stable company with an established position in the market.
  • Attractive salary based on your professional experience and skills.
  • Good working environment.
To apply for the position, please send your application via our page.

We reserve the right to answer only to the chosen candidates.

We kindly ask you to include in the Curriculum Vitae the following passage:
“I hereby give consent for my personal data included in my application to be processed for the purposes of the recruitment process under the Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation)”.

“I also consent to processing of my personal data for the purposes of any future recruitment processes”.

We Are Looking To Strengthen Our Team With a

At Alrec we create powerful retail experiences that turn shoppers into lifelong customers. Having worked with global brands for over 60 years we know what makes the difference. We know retail. Our DNA is shaped by a relentless drive and commitment to do better very time. Rethinking the retail experience characterizes our history and defines our future. We are a full-service provider. We design, develop, manufacture and implement retail solutions. We deliver high quality brand store solutions, shop in shop systems and displays that drive a connected consumer experience and makes us the partner of choice for leading global brands.

190535 – Order Coordinator
Konstantynów Łódzki

You will be part of a small multi-disciplined team responsible for production coordination delivering projects for clients from production order to dispatch to client.

Key Responsibilities
  • Work closely with Alrec’s in house manufacturing facilities and local supply chain
  • Create and manage Production Project Plan
  • Create BOM and manage the production with the manufacturing facilities and outsourced partners keeping to agreed timescales, budgets and quality levels
  • Daily co-operation with the manufacturing facilities ensuring accuracy of communication and expectation management
  • Responsible for reporting project status
  • Management of the quality control process during manufacture and close co-operation with our own internal quality control personnel

Who We Are Looking For
  • Technical degree and some experience in a similar job;
  • Knowledge and experience with MS Office.
  • Experience with ERP software is desirable;
  • Good communication and social skills;
  • Excellent communication skills in English;
  • Ability to multitask and be flexible in dynamic environment of work
  • Experience with engineering and manufacturing is desirable
  • Driving Licence
  • Understanding of manufacturing processes and materials and able to interpret engineering drawings

Our Values

Commitment – Clients can count on our commitment and integrity. We will be responsible for delivering the best solutions and for relentlessly pursuing continuous improvements.
Passion – Retail is our passion. Creating powerful retail experiences inspires us. Finding the best solutions gives us energy.
Innovation – Rethinking the retail experience is what we do. We are always looking for smarter solutions, are on top of trends and translate them into meaningful experiences.

What We Offer
  • A challenging position within an environment where team work, initiative, personal development, co-operation and job satisfaction are the most important elements;

Krzemieniecka 2, zgadzasz się na przetwarzanie przez Pracodawcę Twoich danych osobowych zawartych w zgłoszeniu rekrutacyjnym w celu prowadzenia rekrutacji na stanowisko wskazane w ogłoszeniu.

Jeżeli chcesz, abyśmy zachowali Twoje CV w naszej bazie, umieść dodatkowo w CV następującą zgodę:„Zgadzam się na przetwarzanie przezAlrec In-Store sp. z o.o.,danych osobowych zawartych w moim zgłoszeniu rekrutacyjnym dla celów przyszłych rekrutacji”.
W każdym czasie możesz cofnąć zgodę, kontaktując się z nami pod adresem click apply.

Twoje dane osobowe wskazane w Kodeksie pracy lub w innych ustawach szczegółowych (według wymogów ogłoszenia), przetwarzamy w oparciu o przepisy prawa i ich podanie jest konieczne do wzięcia udziału w rekrutacji. Pozostałe dane osobowe (np. wizerunek) przetwarzamy na podstawie Twojej dobrowolnej zgody, którą wyraziłaś/eś wysyłając nam swoje zgłoszenie rekrutacyjne i ich podanie nie ma wpływu na możliwość udziału w rekrutacji.

Możemy przetwarzać Twoje dane osobowe zawarte w zgłoszeniu rekrutacyjnym także w celu ustalenia, dochodzenia lub obrony przed roszczeniami, jeżeli roszczenia dotyczą prowadzonej przez nas rekrutacji. W tym celu będziemy przetwarzać Twoje dane osobowe w oparciu o nasz prawnie uzasadniony interes, polegający na ustaleniu, dochodzeniu lub obrony przed roszczeniami w postępowaniu przed sądami lub organami państwowymi.

Masz prawo dostępu do swoich danych, w tym uzyskania ich kopii, sprostowania danych, żądania ich usunięcia, ograniczenia przetwarzania, wniesienia sprzeciwu wobec przetwarzania oraz przeniesienia podanych danych (na których przetwarzanie wyraziłeś zgodę) do innego administratora danych. Masz także prawo do wniesienia skargi do Generalnego Inspektora Ochrony Danych Osobowych (w przyszłości: Prezesa Urzędu Ochrony Danych Osobowych). Cofnięcie zgody pozostaje bez wpływu na zgodność z prawem przetwarzania, którego dokonano na podstawie zgody przed jej cofnięciem.

Twoje dane osobowe przetwarzamy w celu prowadzenia rekrutacji na stanowisko wskazane w ogłoszeniu przez okres 6 miesięcy od zakończenia procesu rekrutacji, a gdy wyraziłaś/eś zgodę na udział w przyszłych rekrutacjach przez okres 1 roku od dnia przesłania zgłoszenia rekrutacyjnego. Ponadto Twoje dane osobowe możemy przechowywać dla celów ustalenia, dochodzenia lub obrony przed roszczeniami związanymi z procesem rekrutacji przez okres 3 lat od przesłania zgłoszenia rekrutacyjnego.

Twoje dane osobowe możemy przekazać dostawcom usługi publikacji ogłoszeń o pracę, dostawcom systemów do zarządzania rekrutacjami, dostawcom usług IT takich jak hosting oraz dostawcom systemów informatycznych.

Nie przekazujemy Twoich danych osobowych poza Europejski Obszar Gospodarczy.

position: AP Accountant with English [Online Recruitment Process]
whole_unnormalized_body:
About The Role

The role includes processing of supplier’s invoices, processing T&E, handling of external and internal vendor correspondence and monitoring AP debit balances and blocked invoices.

About You
  • Master degree in Finance, Accounting, similar field, or equivalent by experience.
  • 1-2 years of experience in Accounts Payable.
  • Fluent in English.
  • Good knowledge of SAP and MS Office.
  • Strong process knowledge and business orientation.
  • Very good teamwork and communication skills.
  • Strong analytical and multitasking skills.
  • Organizational skills and accuracy.


Key Resposibilities
  • Process invoices and credit notes in SAP, make tax determinations/interpretation of taxable vs non-taxable items.
  • Handle external and internal vendor correspondences via email and/or phone and provide support to other colleagues.
  • Perform of monthly and yearly close activities.
  • Monitor of AP accounts and ensure compliance.
  • Process T&E, including verification and approval of travel expenses (accuracy, plausibility, compliance with company policy and country tax law), processing costs and payments in SAP, follow-up on open items and handling request for corporate cards.
  • Participate in projects by supporting management and the project team in various tasks.
  • Monitor AP debit balances and blocked invoices and correct any issues as they arise.


We Offer
  • Stable employment in an international organization.
  • Annual bonus based on your work results.
  • Employee Pension Program.
  • Private medical care for you and your family.
  • Sport card.
  • Life insurance.
  • Luncheon vouchers.
  • Discount card for cultural events.
  • Christmas benefits.
  • Chocolate, fruit and vegetables in the office.
  • Opportunity to purchase the company's products at reduced prices.

Wiodąca firma w zarządzaniu łańcuchem dostaw poszukuje Koordynatora Łańcucha Dostaw do obsługi jednego z kluczowych Klientów na terenie Łodzi. Działalność firmy obejmują usługi zaopatrzeniowe, w tym pozyskiwanie komponentów i gotowych towarów, zarządzanie produkcją i jakością dostawców, optymalizację zapasów oraz świadczenie usług o wartości dodanej.

Koordynator Łańcucha Dostaw

Zadania
  • Przygotowanie oraz prezentacja planów zakupowych podczas codziennych narad dotyczących niedoborów;
  • Ścisła współpraca z zespołem ds. Zamówień;
  • Aktualizacja statusu dostaw bieżących potrzeb materiałowych;
  • Identyfikacja działań wymaganych do utrzymania dostaw, np. problemy z integralnością zapasów, odchylenia, zmiany daty wdrożenia nowego produktu itp.;
  • Współpraca z innymi działami firmy w celu ustalenia przyczyn i podjęcia działań naprawczych w odniesieniu do kluczowych kwestii, np. niedoborów;
  • Opracowanie wskaźników dotyczących zamówień związanych z S&P Continuity Of Supply, np. niedobory jako procent zaległości;
  • Identyfikacja podstawowych problemów oraz podjęcie działań naprawczych.

Wymagania
  • Min. 3 letnie doświadczenie na podobnym stanowisku;
  • Dobra znajomość języka angielskiego;
  • Znajomość systemu SAP;
  • Bardzo dobra znajomość pakietu Ms Office;
  • Umiejętność zarządzania ludźmi;
  • Umiejętność pracy pod presją czasu;
  • Dokładność oraz terminowość;
  • Kreatywność i inicjatywa w działaniu;
  • Komunikatywność.

Nasz Klient Oferuje
  • Umowę o pracę;
  • Atrakcyjne wynagrodzenie + benefity;
  • Możliwość rozwoju w międzynarodowej firmie o ugruntowanej pozycji na rynku.

EPCM Executive Search

EPCM to zespół konsultantów executive search prowadzących rekrutacje na kluczowe pozycje w obszarach Engineering, Property, Construction & Management. Specjalizujemy się w rekrutacji managerów i specjalistów z takich branż jak Nieruchomości, Budownictwo, Produkcja, Architektura & Konsulting.

  • Min. 3 letnie doświadczenie na podobnym stanowisku;
  • Dobra znajomość języka angielskiego;
  • Znajomość systemu SAP;
  • Bardzo dobra znajomość pakietu Ms Office;
  • Umiejętność zarządzania ludźmi;
  • Umiejętność pracy pod presją czasu;
  • Dokładność oraz terminowość;
  • Kreatywność i inicjatywa w działaniu;
  • Komunikatywność.

Nasz Klient Oferuje
  • Umowę o pracę;
  • Atrakcyjne wynagrodzenie + benefity;
  • Możliwość rozwoju w międzynarodowej firmie o ugruntowanej pozycji na rynku.

EPCM Executive Search

EPCM to zespół konsultantów executive search prowadzących rekrutacje na kluczowe pozycje w obszarach Engineering, Property, Construction & Management. Specjalizujemy się w rekrutacji managerów i specjalistów z takich branż jak Nieruchomości, Budownictwo, Produkcja, Architektura & Konsulting.

We're looking for an experienced Product Owner.


Tasks to be completed are:

  • Collaboration with stakeholders to manage product Roadmap and Backlog
  • Negotiate schedule, priorities, scope of the product features
  • Work in Scrum and scaled agile (LESS, Nexus)
  • Taking part in product description meetings both internal and external to support pre-sales activities
  • Agile methodology practitioner that grooms and prioritize product backlog for development teams
  • Close collaboration with technical experts to estimate and define the technical solution that meets functional and design aspects
  • Being a member of an international team that cooperates on the payments product portfolio.

Requirements:

  • Use of JIRA / Confluence to facilitate agile ceremonies
  • Familiar with REST/ JSON
  • Fluent in English (excellent verbal and written skills)
  • Understanding of some of existing on the market banking products
  • Strong analytical skills to be able to translate Specification into Epics. Discuss it's business value.
  • Knowledge of UML notation and tools like plantUML
  • Experience in writing Product-related documentation (PFD,FRS, Guides )


Nice to have:

  • Banking related software background either provisioning or processing one.
  • EMVCo, PCI-* Standards understanding
  • Development skills background

  • Knowledge of Security Frameworks and tools as well hardware HSMs
  • Participation in deployment in AWS


Our bonuses:

  • healthcare package
  • leisure package - gym & cinema room
  • fruits & snacks
  • relocation package & visa services
  • trainings and personal development
  • parking in the city centre

Jesteśmy obecni na rynku finansowym od 1999 roku. Naszym głównym celem jest utrzymanie wysokiego poziomu zadowolenia Klienta oraz zapewnienie najwyższych etycznych standardów obsługi. Obecnie posiadamy ponad 100 Oddziałów obsługi sprzedaży bezpośredniej pod marką KredytOK. Głównym naszym produktem oferowanym Klientom jest krótkoterminowa pożyczka gotówkowa, potocznie zwana chwilówką, którą na rynku finansowym spośród innych ofert wyróżniają proste i czytelne zasady pożyczki. Nasi pracownicy to wysoce wykwalifikowani doradcy finansowi, którzy swoją wiedzą i doświadczeniem służą każdemu Klientowi i pomagają w rozwiązywaniu chwilowych problemów finansowych.

W związku z intensywnym rozwojem sieci poszukujemy pracownika na stanowisko:

Opis Stanowiska
  • zarządzanie zespołem pracowników
  • rekrutacja i selekcja pracowników,
  • odpowiedzialność za wyniki sprzedaży w podległym regionie,
  • tworzenie i rozbudowa regionalnej sieci sprzedaży,
  • rekomendowanie działań wpływających na zwiększenie sprzedaży oraz monitorowanie trendów rynkowych i działań konkurencji.

Wymagania
  • doświadczenie w sprzedaży na stanowisku kierowniczym,
  • doświadczenie w zarządzaniu zespołem
  • bardzo dobre umiejętności analityczne,
  • orientacja na wyniki,
  • znajomość rynku usług finansowych,
  • gotowość do podjęcia pracy wymagającej częstych podróży służbowych (ponad 70% czasu pracy),
  • prawo jazdy kat. B,
  • niekaralność.

Oferujemy
  • umowę o pracę na cały etat – w dużej firmie jednak z rodzinną atmosferą
  • ciekawą, samodzielną i pełną wyzwań pracę,
  • atrakcyjne wynagrodzenie uzależnione od wyników,
  • samochód służbowy, laptop, telefon
  • ubezpieczenie grupowe oraz pakiet sportowy
  • pracę w dynamicznym i nowoczesnym otoczeniu biznesowym
Company Name: Capital Service S.A. - loan originator, financial broker

position: Junior Software Engineer in Autonomous Driving Team
whole_unnormalized_body:
At TomTom…

You’ll move the world forward. Every day, we create the most innovative mapping and location technologies to shape tomorrow’s mobility for the better.

We are proud to be one team of more than 5,000 unique, curious, passionate problem-solvers spread across the world. We bring out the best in each other. And together, we help the automotive industry, businesses, developers, drivers, citizens, and cities move towards a safe, autonomous world that is free of congestion and emissions.

What You’ll Do
  • Act as a test engineer in the Autonomous-Driving product unit developing software and services for self-driving- and driving-assisted cars
  • Work on software test specifications and implementation of test cases accordingly
  • Test execution, bug reporting, analysis, and error verification
  • Collaborate with the Agile team to improve product quality & to perform software testing

What You’ll Need
  • Experience with testing Java-based server application running on a public cloud platform
  • Experience with unit test frameworks like JUnit
  • Experience with BDD frameworks like JBehave
  • Ability to select and/or build automated test frameworks and help with integrating these in the CI environment
  • Automation background
  • Experience with CI/CD pipeline (eg. Jenkins)
  • Good communication skills and a proactive attitude

Nice to have
  • Programming experience (Java, JavaScript or Python)
  • Writing shell scripts
  • Data analysis

Meet your team

We’re Autonomous Driving (AD). Our product unit develops, delivers and maintains products for advanced driver-assistance systems and automated driving – with the TomTom HD Map at the core of our work. Every day, we welcome new challenges, do world-class R&D and apply it using the latest machine learning and computer vision techniques. On our team, you’ll not only play a part in making autonomous driving a reality, you’ll transform the way people commute while boosting safety and comfort for everyone on the road.

Завод з виготовлення пряжі (ниток) LEGS

►Місто роботи:м. Александрув Лодзький.

►Оплата праці: 12,72- 13,50 zl/год нетто (залежить від якості виконання роботи).

►Графік роботи:по 10-12 робочих годин, 2-3 зміни.

►Документи:робоча віза мін. 5 місяці.

►Вимоги:

  • чоловіки, жінки, сімейні пари до 50 років;
  • фізично здорові;
  • досвід необов’язковий;
  • готовність до роботи;
  • хороший зір.
►Обов’язки працівника:

  • робота на верстатах;
  • обслуговування машин для виробництва пряжі (ниток);
  • стежити за тим, щоб нитки йшли правильно, зав’язувати їх, якщо розриваються.
►Житло:безкоштовне проживання у пересувних будиночках на території заводу; двохрівневі ліжка, по 4-6 осіб в кімнаті; обладнана кухня (плита, холодильник, мікрохвильова піч). Ванна кімната – душ. Wi-Fi.

►Додаткові умови:

  • від місця проживання до робочого місця 5 хв пішки;
  • на виробництві шумно, тому працюють в бірушах (наушниках);
  • роботодавець частину коштів дає на обід (у заводській їдальні), робочий одяг.
  • можливий аванс після відпрацювання 5 днів.
►Деталі за телефонами:

UWAGA! NASZA AGENCJA NIE POBIERA ŻADNYCH PROWIZJI LUB OPŁAT OD OSÓB POSZUKUJĄCYCH PRACY LUB PRACUJĄCYCH ZA NASZYM POŚREDNICTWEM. *

Agencja Pracy Select, firma działająca w obszarze doradztwa personalnego, pośrednictwa pracy oraz pracy tymczasowej, należąca do Business Solutions Wojciech Karłowski (nr W rej. Agencji Zatrudnienia: 3891), dla swojego Klienta, poszukuje kandydatów na stanowisko:

ELEKTRYK

Nr ref.: ELEKTRYK/NIEMCY/2018
Lokalizacja: Niemcy
Rodzaj pracy: praca stała

Zadania Na Danym Stanowisku
  • Instalacje elektryczne w domach/mieszkaniach.
  • Instalacje przemysłowe.
  • Składanie szaf wg schematów.
Wymagania, Jakie Stawiamy Kandydatom
  • Ukończone wykształcenie na kierunku elektryk lub pokrewne.
  • Wieloletnie doświadczenie w zawodzie.
  • Prawo jazdy kat. B + samochód - mile widziane.
  • Uprawnienia SEP do 1 kV.
  • Absolutna niezawodność i zdolność do samodzielnej pracy.
  • Znajomość języka niemieckiego-mile widziana.
Osobie Zatrudnionej Oferujemy
  • Niemieckie warunki pracy, niemiecka umowa.
  • Wynagrodzenie: 11,40€/h brutto + dieta 50€ do 65€ za dzień pracy w zależności od znajomości języka i posiadanego doświadczenia.
Informujemy, że skontaktujemy się wyłącznie z wybranymi osobami oraz nie zwracamy nadesłanych aplikacji.

Po zapoznaniu się z poniższą informacją zainteresowane osoby prosimy o przesyłanie CV z podanym stanowiskiem w tytule wiadomości, na adres: kadry@select-hr.pl

Zgodnie z Rozporządzeniem UE 2016/679 z dnia 27 kwietnia 2016 r. informujemy, że:
  • administratorem Pani/Pana danych osobowych jest BUSINESS SOLUTIONS Wojciech Karłowski z siedzibą w Bełchatowie przy ul. Kaczyńskich 4 zwany dalej administratorem, administrator prowadzi operacje przetwarzania Pani/Pana danych osobowych;
  • administrator nie ma obowiązku powoływania inspektora danych osobowych;
  • Pani/Pana dane osobowe przetwarzane będą w celu rekrutacji na wskazane w ofercie stanowisko i będą udostępniane potencjalnym pracodawcom;
  • podanie danych jest niezbędne do przeprowadzenia procesu rekrutacji zgodnie z Art. 6 ust. 1 lit. a) RODO.
  • posiada Pani/Pan prawo do:
  • żądania od Administratora dostępu do swoich danych osobowych, ich sprostowania, usunięcia lub ograniczenia przetwarzania danych osobowych,
  • wniesienia sprzeciwu wobec takiego przetwarzania,
  • przenoszenia danych,
  • wniesienia skargi do organu nadzorczego,
  • cofnięcia zgody na przetwarzanie danych osobowych.
  • Pani/Pana dane osobowe nie podlegają zautomatyzowanemu podejmowaniu decyzji, w tym profilowaniu,
