Company Name: Agencja Zatrudnienia Sidrom Sp. z o.o.

whole_unnormalized_body:
Dołącz do firmy ABB i podejmij pracę w zespole mającym wpływ na tworzenie przyszłości, w której innowacyjne technologie cyfrowe będą zapewniały większy dostęp do czystszej energii.

Osoba zatrudniona na tym stanowisku będzie odpowiedzialna za projektowanie części aktywnej transformatorów mocy.

Twoje obowiązki
  • Uzgodnienia techniczne z klientami.
  • Przygotowywanie projektów elektrycznych części aktywnych transformatorów mocy (optymalizacja, obliczenia zwarciowe, cieplne, dielektryczne).
  • Ocena i minimalizacja ryzyk technicznych związanych z realizacją projektów.
  • Przygotowywanie zapotrzebowań na materiały potrzebne w procesie produkcji.
  • Wykonywanie dokumentacji konstrukcyjnej.
  • Nadzór nad transformatorem podczas jego produkcji.

    • Twoje kompetencje
  • Wykształcenie wyższe, preferowani będą absolwenci Wydziałów Elektrycznych.
  • Umiejętność wykonywania obliczeń wytrzymałości układów izolacyjnych z wykorzystaniem Metody Elementów Skończonych.
  • Umiejętność obsługi programów CAD, znajomość PTC Creo Parametric będzie dodatkowym atutem.
  • Znajomość języka angielskiego umożliwiająca swobodną komunikację.
  • Umiejętność pracy w zespole oraz dobra organizacja pracy własnej.
  • Umiejętność rozwiązywania problemów, zdolność do podejmowania decyzji.
  • Odporność na stres. Umiejętność podejmowania inicjatywy. Komunikatywność.
  • Gotowość do współpracy w środowisku międzynarodowym.
  • Preferowane będą osoby z doświadczeniem w projektowaniu.

    • Więcej o nas
    Wnieś swoje własne poczucie dumy i celu, pomagając nam rozwijać Czwartą Rewolucję Przemysłową – tworząc zrównoważoną przyszłość naszej planety i Twojej kariery. Dołącz do ABB i wykorzystaj siłę naszej zróżnicowanej globalnej sieci, współpracując i ucząc się od naszych światowej klasy zespołów. Przede wszystkim stawiaj sobie wyzwanie każdego dnia. Napiszmy przyszłość razem.

    To wyjątkowy moment na dołączenie do ABB Power Grids. ABB i Hitachi podpisały porozumienie o utworzeniu spółki joint venture (JV). Chcemy stać się nowym światowym liderem w sektorze energetyki dzięki wykorzystaniu mocnych stron obu firm. ABB Power Grids i Hitachi to w sumie 230 lat tradycji i doświadczenia na rynku. Razem będziemy w stanie kształtować przyszłość energetyki za pomocą pionierskich technologii i staniemy się preferowanym partnerem w budowaniu mocniejszej, bardziej inteligentnej i ekologicznej sieci energetycznej. Proces tworzenia jednej spółki ma zostać zakończony w pierwszej połowie 2020 roku, po otrzymaniu wymaganych zezwoleń. Przyłącz się do tej pasjonującej podróży.

    Oferujemy:

  • Interesującą pracę w firmie nastawionej na innowacyjne rozwiązania i nowoczesne technologie.
  • Możliwość rozwoju zawodowego w międzynarodowym środowisku i podnoszenia kwalifikacji zawodowych w różnych obszarach.
  • Stabilność zatrudnienia w firmie o ugruntowanej pozycji rynkowej.
  • Atrakcyjne warunki zatrudnienia uzależnione od doświadczenia i posiadanych umiejętności.
  • Miłą atmosferę pracy.

    • Osoby zainteresowane prosimy o przesyłanie CV za pośrednictwem naszej strony klikając na przycisk „Aplikuj”.

    Zastrzegamy sobie prawo odpowiedzi wyłącznie na wybrane oferty.

    Wszystkie oferty powinny zawierać klauzulę:

    „Wyrażam zgodę na przetwarzanie moich danych osobowych w celu rekrutacji zgodnie z art. 6 ust. 1 lit. a Rozporządzenia Parlamentu Europejskiego i Rady (UE) 2016/679 z dnia 27 kwietnia 2016 r. w sprawie ochrony osób fizycznych w związku z przetwarzaniem danych osobowych i w sprawie swobodnego przepływu takich danych oraz uchylenia dyrektywy 95/46/WE (ogólne rozporządzenie o ochronie danych)”.
    „Wyrażam również zgodę na przetwarzanie moich danych osobowych w celu prowadzenia przyszłych rekrutacji”.
    Transformers

Dołącz do firmy ABB i podejmij pracę w zespole mającym wpływ na tworzenie przyszłości, w której innowacyjne technologie cyfrowe będą zapewniały większy dostęp do czystszej energii.

Zespół BHP jest zaufanym partnerem biznesowym wyznaczającym kierunek strategiczny i dostarczającym skuteczne oraz wydajne usługi, które promują zdrowie, bezpieczeństwo, środowisko i odpowiedzialność korporacyjną w zrównoważonych praktykach biznesowych.
Poszukujemy osoby, która dołączy do zespołu BHP jako Starszy Specjalista ds. BHP. Wybrana osoba będzie odpowiedzialna za podejmowanie działań kształtujących kulturę bezpieczeństwa i higieny pracy w działach produkcji, sprzedaży i biurowych.

Twoje obowiązki
  • Realizacja zadań służby BHP, wynikających z aktualnie obowiązujących przepisów i prowadzenie dokumentacji BHP zgodnie z regulacjami prawnymi.
  • Prowadzenie szkoleń tematycznych z zakresu BHP.
  • Uczestniczenie w doskonaleniu i nadzorowaniu wewnętrznego systemu bezpieczeństwa i higieny pracy w zakładzie produkcyjnym.
  • Doradztwo z zakresu BHP - aktywny udział i doradztwo we wdrażaniu inwestycji i rozwiązań technicznych w procesie produkcyjnym.
  • Analiza zdarzeń potencjalnie wypadkowych oraz wypadków (badanie przyczyn wypadków przy pracy, prowadzenie dokumentacji powypadkowej oraz wdrażanie działań zapobiegawczych).
  • Udział w ocenie ryzyka zawodowego oraz sporządzaniu dokumentacji chorób zawodowych, wyników badań i pomiarów czynników szkodliwych dla zdrowia.
  • Przeprowadzanie audytów wewnętrznych w zakresie BHP.
  • Przeprowadzanie analiz stanu BHP, ocen zgodności z mającymi zastosowanie przepisami prawa i innymi oraz sporządzanie odpowiednich raportów.
  • Bieżące kontrole stanowisk pracy w zakresie przestrzegania zasad BHP.

    • Twoje kompetencje
  • Wykształcenie wyższe (kierunek: Bezpieczeństwo i Higiena Pracy).
  • Praktyczna znajomość przepisów BHP.
  • Co najmniej 5 lat doświadczenia na podobnym stanowisku.
  • Doświadczenie w pracy w zakładzie produkcyjnym mile widziane.
  • Umiejętność przeprowadzania szkoleń i audytów wewnętrznych.
  • Bardzo dobra znajomość języka angielskiego (zarówno w piśmie jak i mowie).
  • Bardzo dobra znajomość obsługi komputera (Excel).
  • Samodzielność w działaniu, odpowiedzialność.
  • Umiejętność rozwiązywania problemów.

    • Więcej o nas
    To wyjątkowy moment na dołączenie do ABB Power Grids. ABB i Hitachi podpisały porozumienie o utworzeniu spółki joint venture (JV). Chcemy stać się nowym światowym liderem w sektorze energetyki dzięki wykorzystaniu mocnych stron obu firm. ABB Power Grids i Hitachi to w sumie 230 lat tradycji i doświadczenia na rynku. Razem będziemy w stanie kształtować przyszłość energetyki za pomocą pionierskich technologii i staniemy się preferowanym partnerem w budowaniu mocniejszej, bardziej inteligentnej i ekologicznej sieci energetycznej. Proces tworzenia jednej spółki ma zostać zakończony w pierwszej połowie 2020 roku, po otrzymaniu wymaganych zezwoleń. Przyłącz się do tej pasjonującej podróży.

    Oferujemy:

  • Interesującą pracę w firmie nastawionej na innowacyjne rozwiązania i nowoczesne technologie.
  • Stabilność zatrudnienia w firmie o ugruntowanej pozycji rynkowej.
  • Możliwość rozwoju zawodowego w międzynarodowym środowisku i podnoszenia kwalifikacji zawodowych.
  • Atrakcyjny pakiet benefitów (Prywatna opieka medyczna, karta Multisport, ubezpieczenie na życie).

    • Osoby zainteresowane prosimy o przesyłanie CV za pośrednictwem naszej strony klikając na przycisk „Aplikuj”.

    Równocześnie zastrzegamy sobie prawo odpowiedzi wyłącznie na wybrane oferty.

    Wszystkie oferty powinny zawierać klauzulę: „Wyrażam zgodę na przetwarzanie moich danych osobowych w celu rekrutacji zgodnie z art. 6 ust. 1 lit. a Rozporządzenia Parlamentu Europejskiego i Rady (UE) 2016/679 z dnia 27 kwietnia 2016 r. w sprawie ochrony osób fizycznych w związku z przetwarzaniem danych osobowych i w sprawie swobodnego przepływu takich danych oraz uchylenia dyrektywy 95/46/WE (ogólne rozporządzenie o ochronie danych)”.
    „Wyrażam również zgodę na przetwarzanie moich danych osobowych w celu prowadzenia przyszłych rekrutacji”.
    Business Function Health, Safety & Env.

In this Regulatory Specialist role, you have the opportunity to support the regulatory team in ensuring compliance with product and device marking requirements within the Oral Healthcare team. This includes working under the direction of the regulatory team and with internal business groups, ensuring compliance to product regulatory requirements.

Your responsibilities going to be divided into two parts:

Artwork Review for format and content in vendor tool (SGS) per regulatory requirements. Perform additional product and documentation review tasks.

Support Philips labeling proces:

  • Create, edit and route regulatory graphics for product (type plates):

    • Using Adobe Illustrator with standard templates to create regulatory type plates.
    • Managing stakeholders and deadlines effectively.
  • Route specification documents for approval and release:

    • Using Philips Product Data Management system to process document routing.
  • Document and improve process in coordination with US team.

You are a part of

Our Global Competence Center in Łódź, where we centralize our business processes. We bring together supporting roles within HR, Finance, Procurement, Customer Service, Supply Chain and other, enabling you to have a career in an international, cross functional environment. Your future colleagues speak 25+ languages and represent 15+ different nationalities, supporting our operations in 50 countries on a daily basis.

You will be part of the Safety and Compliance Regulatory team, supporting regulatory definition and oversight for Philips products and related project needs within the regulatory team. The first business you will support is Philips Oral Health Care.

To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience

  • Fluent English language skills
  • Highly detail oriented and able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously
  • Quickly learner
  • Bachelor’s degree or relevant experience in the regulatory role
  • Minimum of 2 years of experience supporting regulatory compliance efforts
  • Exceptional communication skills for coordinating remote teams of many nationalities
  • Demonstrated proficiency with electronic record-keeping system
  • Microsoft Office experience, including Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and Notes
  • Adobe Acrobat experience for editing and annotating PDFs
  • Must be experienced with Adobe Illustrator (create, edit and layer management of product graphics for both text and icons)
  • Familiar with the use of Product Data Management (PDM) systems - highly preferred
  • Experience working in ISO 9000 / ISO 13485 or similar regulated business preferred

In return, we offer you

The unique combination of a critical and challenging role and a creative and empowering office environment. You will be actively encouraged to make improvements, establish best in class service and have a direct impact on the success of Philips on a daily basis.

  • Annual bonus based on performance achieved
  • Private medical care with option to extend it to family members
  • Benefit System cards
  • Discount for Philips’ products
  • Language courses
  • Relocation package applicable for people moving in from outside of Łódź region
  • Promotion of healthy lifestyle in the office (fruits twice / week in the office, gym, massage chairs, various events)

Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watching this video.

To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there,you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.

position: Junior/Process Officer, Cash Management Operations, Łódź
whole_unnormalized_body:
Would you like to develop your knowledge around cash management services and get closer to the world of banking? We are now looking for a Junior/Process Officer join teams in Cash Management Operations.

In Nordea, we know that great customer experiences require a team that leads the way in first-class service and operations. We’re more than just a Nordic bank, we’re a large employer in Poland. With us, you’ll work with skilled, international teams in a bright, modern office. The lively and collaborative atmosphere offers plenty of opportunities to learn and grow as you build your career with us.

About This Opportunity

Welcome to the Cash Management Operation team. We add value by enabling customers to use the services Nordea offers. As Junior/Process Officer, you’ll play a valuable role in in operating and enabling Nordea’s customers to use our services.

What you’ll be doing
  • Ensuring sustainability of the processes and delivering with respect to agreed service level
  • Producing changes to improve performance in terms of tasks performed (LEAN methodology)
  • Cooperating with stakeholders and retained teams situated in Nordic countries
  • Creating, developing and updating documentation and procedures

You’ll join a team consisting of vigorous, young, but experienced people who are eager to cooperate. The role is based in Łódź.

Who You Are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.

To succeed in this role, we believe that you
  • Have capability to work under pressure and prioritize tasks
  • Get motivated by working in a changing environment
  • Have ability to work effectively as a team player

Your experience and background
  • Finance-related university degree or equivalent professional experience
  • English on communicative level (at least B2)
  • Good knowledge of MS Office tools
  • Problem-solving and organizational skills
  • Attention to details and clear communication skills

If this sounds like you, get in touch!
Next steps
Submit your application no later than 15 April 2020.

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following

In accordance with art. 13 par. 1 and par. 2 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GPDR’ I inform that
  • The Administrator of your personal data is Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź, hereinafter referred to as the company
  • Data Protection Officer in the company is Esa Kainulainen, e-mail dataprotectionoffice@nordea.com
  • Applications for specific positions are kept for two years after the recruitment process has ended. Open applications to our candidate database are kept for six months, after which they will automatically be deleted, unless you choose to renew your application. We will send you an e-mail reminder before the six months have passed and ask if you would like to renew your application. You may request an open application to be deleted at any time.
  • For e-mail notifications of new positions via our Job Agent, the personal data you submit is kept until you choose to unsubscribe from the service..
  • Your personal data will not be shared with other recipients.
  • Your personal data will not be shared with third countries.
  • You have a right to access your personal data and the right to rectify, delete, limit processing, the right to object, the right to withdraw consent at any time without affecting the legality of processing, which was made based on consent before its withdrawal.
  • You have a right to lodge a complaint with the supervisory body when you feel that the processing of personal data violates the provisions of the general regulation on the protection of personal data of April 27, 2016.
  • Providing your personal data is voluntary, but necessary to conduct the recruitment process. Failure to provide personal data necessary to conduct the recruitment process, in particular personal data specified in the art. 221
  • 1 of the Labor Code from June 26, 1974 (Journal of Laws 2019.1040 i.e. from June 6, 2019) will cause the application to be left without recognition by the Administrator.
  • Your personal data will not be processed in an automated way, including the form of profiling.

    • These rights mentioned in the point 6 and 7 can be executed at any time by submitting a written declaration, in person or by sending correspondence to the address of Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmigłego 20, 93-281 or by e-mail dataprotectionoffice@nordea.com

    We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

Position: Accounts Receivable Analyst with Portuguese

Based: Łódź, Poland

Main Responsibilities
  • Deduction management and resolution
  • Root cause analysis and issue resolution
  • Customer Service, sales team and customer interface
  • Process improvements
  • Understand customer deals/pricing and load/maintain customer contracts
  • Application of cash and processing customer remittances
  • Providing support for the other team members when needed (as assigned by the supervisor)

  • Very good level of Portuguese and English
  • Business Administration, Accounting, Finance Degree or equivalent
  • Minimum 1 year of experience in credit, accounting, customer services or related field

job_description_details.Industry: Food & Beverages Food Production Consumer Goods

whole_unnormalized_body:
In this role, you have the opportunity to:

To drive and grow GBS value, to set and achieve financial and strategic targets of Hub and to participate in Hub MT to ensure financially sound decision-making.

You are responsible for:

  • Supporting GBS Hub strategic decisions by means of sound business analysis (business modeling, opportunity & risk assessments, scenario analysis, etc.)
  • As Finance leader, driving, executing organizational and performance improvements through Hub Leadership Team by means of a strategically aligned and solid factual plan as well as an understanding of Shared Service Organization operating model.
  • Monitoring the financial position of the Hub. Identifying risks and opportunities to current financial projections and takes corrective actions where needed (e.g. cost improvements, productivity improvement).
  • Coordinating and leading the Hub Monthly Finance Review Meeting, AOP reviews, reports and analysis.
  • Managing relationships with other finance pillars, gathering inputs and jointly ensuring financial control
  • Business integrity: Monitoring & controlling functional processes and their execution for ICS/SOX compliance. Maintaining proper financial documentation & adherence to GBP.

To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience:

  • Bachelors’ degree in Finance with at least 5 years relevant experience
  • Deep understanding of Shared Service Finance Operating Model and business risk analysis.
  • Able to work with cross-functional & multiple stakeholders with multiple priorities.
  • Uses professional concepts and company objectives to resolve complex issues in creative and effective ways.
  • Effective, planning, organization and communication skills. Ability to work under pressure and dynamic environment.
  • Strong influencing skills through effective communication and leadership techniques
  • Ability to recognize organizational and business differences and work to effect alignments
  • Fluent in English (both written and spoken)

In return, we offer you

The unique combination of a critical and challenging role and a creative and empowering office environment. You will be actively encouraged to make improvements, establish best in class service and have a direct impact on the success of Philips on a daily basis.

  • Annual bonus based on performance achieved
  • Private medical care with option to extend it to family members
  • Benefit System cards
  • Discount for Philips’ products
  • Language courses
  • Relocation package applicable for people moving in from outside of Łódź region
  • Promotion of healthy lifestyle in the office (fruits twice / week in the office, gym, massage chairs, various events)

Based: Łódź, Poland

                   

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES

 

  • Deduction management and resolution
  • Root cause analysis and issue resolution
  • Customer Service, sales team and customer interface
  • Process improvements
  • Understand customer deals/pricing and load/maintain customer contracts
  • Application of cash and processing customer remittances
  • Providing support for the other team members when needed (as assigned by the supervisor)

By clicking the “Apply” button, I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that I agree with Takeda’s Privacy Notice, Privacy Policy and Terms of Use.

Job Description

As a GL & Reporting Specialist, working in the Accounting & Reporting team, your typical day will include:
  • Month-end closing activities in area of General Ledger and Group Reporting
  • Reconciliation of accounts based on supporting documentation
  • Coordination of statutory reporting process
  • Cooperation with external providers in process of statutory and tax reporting
  • Cooperation with financial auditors
  • Fixed assets transactions postings
  • Performing Internal Controls in areas of General Ledger, Fixed Assets and Group Reporting

Required Qualifications
  • Academic background in accounting or economics
  • Professional experience in GL/FA/Reporting area
  • Professional experience in BPO/Shared Services would be an asset
  • Additional accounting courses would be an asset
  • SAP knowledge
  • Knowledge of Excel
  • Fluent English
  • Good communication & interpersonal skills
  • Customer orientation
  • Stress resistance, discipline, dedication

What Takeda Can Offer You
  • We take care of you - group insurance, private healthcare and Christmas vouchers,
  • We take care of your appetite - delicious meals in the canteen, meals delivery service, fresh fruits,
  • We take care of your comfort - quiet, cozy office with creative corner and chillout zones, integration trips and events,
  • We take care of your development - language courses and trainings, Takeda Running Team and corporate volunteering

Locations

Lodz, Poland

Worker Type

Employee

Worker Sub-Type

Regular

Full time

Junior Process Officer with SWEDISH (back-office)

Workplace: Łodź

Full – time job contract We do not require experience

monitoring orders in supported applications

analysis of banking processes, initiation and implementation of improvement activities

Swedish communicative level (at least B2)

whole_unnormalized_body:
Wyzwania, Jakie Na Ciebie Czekają
  • koordynowanie działań ochrony obiektów handlowych - poszukujemy 2óch Kandydatów na tereny województw: mazowieckiego i łódzkiego oraz łódzkiego i wielkopolskiego,
  • utrzymywanie pozytywnych relacji z klientami,
  • nadzór nad prawidłową realizacją usług i dbanie o ich wysoką jakość,
  • wdrażanie oraz szkolenie nowych pracowników,
  • prowadzenie dokumentacji związanej z zarządzaniem pracownikami i kontraktem,
  • kształtowanie pozytywnego wizerunku Securitas.

Oczekiwania, Jakie Mamy w Stosunku Do Ciebie
  • dobra znajomość branży ochrony osób i mienia,
  • wpis na listę Kwalifikowanych Pracowników Ochrony będzie dodatkowym atutem,
  • wykształcenie minimum średnie,
  • doświadczenie związane z ochroną obiektów handlowych,
  • doświadczenie w zarządzaniu (stanowisko Dowódcy, Szefa Obiektu itp.)
  • samodzielność, odpowiedzialność,
  • dyspozycyjność, odporność na stres,
  • wysoka kultura osobista,
  • dobra umiejętność obsługi komputera (MS Office),
  • prawo jazdy kat B,
  • niekaralność.

Ze Swojej Strony Oferujemy
  • stabilne warunki zatrudnienia (umowa o pracę),
  • stałe wynagrodzenie zasadnicze + premie uzależnione od wyników,
  • realne wsparcie przełożonych w codziennej pracy,
  • wszystkie potrzebne narzędzia pracy (samochód służbowy, laptop, smartfon),
  • ubezpieczenie NNW opłacone przez pracodawcę,
  • karnet sportowo-rekreacyjny,
  • pakiet medyczny,
  • dofinansowanie do nauki języka angielskiego,
  • przyjazną atmosferę bazującą na szacunku i współpracy,
  • możliwość awansu i rozwoju w strukturach firmy.

Jesteśmy skandynawskim koncernem ochrony.
Pozycję lidera na światowym rynku zdobyliśmy dzięki pracownikom
oraz nowoczesnym zintegrowanym rozwiązaniom technicznym.

Do naszego zespołu poszukujemy obecnie kandydatów na stanowisko:

In this role, you have the opportunity to provide operational support to our healthcare customers on daily basis for back office Customer Service department in multinational environment, covering administrative activities of the Contracts, Billing, Parts Central and Parts Reverse.

You are responsible for

Contract:

  • Creating & renewing service contracts and extended warranties
  • Modifying existing contracts and extended warranties for appropriate services execution of pricing and billing information
  • Terminating contracts according to documentation received from stakeholders
  • Connecting the correct installed based products
  • Issuing invoices and credit/debit notes
  • Verifying customers entitlements on ad-hoc requests

Parts:

  • Receiving POs from customer and Service Engineers for spare parts
  • Processing POs in the system which end with automatic request to transportation department
  • Managing invoice disputes on customer requests including issuing credit & debit invoices
  • Informing customers about delays and interruptions with delivery
  • Managing customers queries for spare parts such as price requests or follow-up on PO status

You are a part of Global Competence Center in Łódź, where we centralize our transactional processes. We bring together supporting roles within HR, Finance, Procurement, Customer Service, Supply Chain and other, enabling you to have a career in an international, cross functional environment. Your future colleagues speak 25+ languages and represent 15+ different nationalities, supporting our operations in 50 countries on a daily basis.

In Customer Service – the most multilanguage department in GBS, you will have an opportunity to work with colleagues in various languages on multinational projects, where honest, professional, friendly atmosphere and sense of humor shape our culture.

To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience

  • Bachelor’s degree
  • Fluent English
  • Professional experience in fields related to in customer service or supply chain or accounting operations would be an asset
  • Communicative level (B2+) of other languages would be an asset
  • Comprehensive PC skills, knowledge of Excel, SAP, Salesforce would be an advantage
  • Problem solving mindset with ability to identify improvement opportunities
  • Interpersonal skills required in interactions with internal and external customers
  • Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment. Skill in prioritizing tasks required
  • Good organizational skills and aptitude for details

In return, we offer you

  • Annual bonus based on performance achieved
  • Private medical care with option to extend it to family members
  • Benefit System cards
  • Discount for Philips’ products
  • Language courses
  • Relocation package applicable for people moving in from outside of Łódź region
  • Promotion of healthy lifestyle in the office (fruits twice / week in the office, gym, massage chairs, various events)

Why should you join Philips?

Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watching this video.

To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there,you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.

Join ABB and work in a team that is dedicated to creating a future where innovative digital technologies allow greater access to cleaner energy.

We are currently looking for the right candidate for the position of Business Controller in Aleksandrów Łódzki. The successful candidate will support local finance activities connected to the core factory functions.


Your Responsibilities
  • Budgets and monthly forecast preparation;
  • Cooperation with business management in monthly closing activities;
  • Performing monthly and quarterly SOX controls;
  • Planning and controlling of fixed and variable costs;
  • Maintaining business structure in SAP system – costs centers, profit centers, hourly and overheads rates calculation;
  • Preparation of data for monthly business reviews;
  • Controlling over financial part of development projects / production transfers;
  • Executes analysis and reports as assigned and take proactive role in development of internal reporting systems;
  • Supporting factory management decisions;
  • Preparation of calculation models for products;
  • Preparation and analysis of post calculation for sold products.
  • Living ABB’s core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business.

Your background
  • Completed degree in higher education in Finance or Controlling;
  • Minimum 3 years of experience in a Finance function in production company;
  • Strong user knowledge of Microsoft Office and Excel skills;
  • Good knowledge of SAP modules;
  • Good knowledge of English – written and verbal communication skills;
  • Process orientation and attention to details;
  • Strong analytical and problem solving ability;
  • Ability to work individually or in teams and with deadlines;
  • Understanding of financial accounting, reporting, planning, controlling, assurance, internal control, treasury or investment is an advantage.

More About Us
Bring your very own sense of pride and purpose as you help us drive forward the Fourth Industrial Revolution – creating a sustainable future for our planet, and your career. Join ABB and harness the power of our diverse global network, as you collaborate with and learn from our world-class teams. Above all, challenge yourself every day. Let’s write the future, together.

We offer:
  • An interesting job in a company promoting innovative and modern technologies.
  • Opportunity for professional development in an international environment and for increasing your abilities and skills in various areas.
  • Employment in a stable company with an established position in the market.
  • Attractive salary based on your professional experience and skills.
  • Good working environment.
To apply for the position, please send your application (Curriculum Vitae) via our page.

We reserve the right to answer only to the chosen candidates.

We kindly ask you to include in the Curriculum Vitae the following passage:

“I hereby give consent for my personal data included in my application to be processed for the purposes of the recruitment process under the Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation)”.

“I also consent to processing of my personal data for the purposes of any future recruitment processes”.

position: Specjalista Kontroli Jakości / Quality Control Specialist
whole_unnormalized_body:
By clicking the “Apply” button, I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that I agree with Takeda’s Privacy Notice, Privacy Policy and Terms of Use.

Job Description

This job requires proficiency in Polish.

Witamy Cię w Takedzie. Dziękujemy za to, że poświęcasz swój czas na poznanie naszej organizacji. Jesteśmy globalną firmą farmaceutyczną z ponad 230-letnią historią. Najważniejsza dla Takedy jest poprawa zdrowia pacjentów na całym świecie, dlatego każdego dnia pracujemy z pasją, by osiągać ten cel. Zatrudnienie w Takedzie oznacza pracę w prestiżowej, rozpoznawalnej organizacji. W naszej firmie dbamy o przyjazną atmosferę, respektujemy prywatność pracowników i zachęcamy do zachowania równowagi między życiem zawodowym i prywatnym. Serdecznie zapraszamy do jednego z naszych biur, gdzie z przyjemnością opowiemy Ci, dlaczego warto dołączyć do Naszego zespołu.

Aktualnie do Zakładu Produkcyjnego w Łyszkowicach poszukujemy kandydatów na stanowisko Specjalista Kontroli Jakości.

Zakres Obowiązków
  • Samodzielne wykonywanie i ocenę badań chemicznych (badania chromatograficzne oraz badania fizykochemiczne) w celu dostarczania informacji o jakości badanych surowców, leków, materiałów opakowaniowych w oparciu o normy, specyfikacje, farmakopeę, zasady GMP i GLP
  • Przeprowadzenie działań wyjaśniających w przypadku uzyskania wyniku nietypowego, niezgodnego ze specyfikacją
  • Prowadzenie dokumentacji analitycznej
  • Nadzorowanie wykonywania badań chemicznych i sprawdzanie raportów z walidacji i kwalifikacji
  • Opiniowanie i sprawdzanie instrukcji, procedur oraz raportów z badań
  • Uczestnictwo w transferach metod analitycznych zewnętrznych oraz wewnętrznych
  • Przygotowywanie roztworów odczynników i wzorców oraz racjonalne ich wykorzystanie

Wymagania
  • Wykształcenie wyższe chemiczne, farmaceutyczne lub pokrewne
  • Minimum 2 lata doświadczenia w pracy na podobnym stanowisku w branży farmaceutycznej
  • Wiedza analityczna
  • Znajomość zagadnień z zakresu walidacji metod analitycznych
  • Znajomość technik analitycznych HPLC, GC, spektrofotometria (znajomość obszaru badań stabilności mile widziana)
  • Znajomość GMP oraz GLP
  • Znajomość obsługi pakietu MS Office
  • Znajomości języka angielskiego w stopniu komunikatywnym
  • Umiejętność współpracy w zespole
  • Umiejętność rozwiązywania problemów
  • Umiejętność organizacji pracy własnej oraz samodzielności

Oferujemy
  • Stabilne zatrudnienie
  • Pakiet socjalny (opieka medyczna, ubezpieczenie grupowe, dofinansowanie posiłków w stołówce zakładowej)
  • Ciekawą pracę w środowisku międzynarodowej firmy produkcyjnej
  • Możliwość rozwoju i doskonalenia zawodowego
  • Dobrą atmosferę pracy

position: Specjalista Kontroli Jakości / Quality Control Specialist
whole_unnormalized_body:
By clicking the “Apply” button, I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that I agree with Takeda’s Privacy Notice, Privacy Policy and Terms of Use.

Job Description

This job requires proficiency in Polish.

Witamy Cię w Takedzie. Dziękujemy za to, że poświęcasz swój czas na poznanie naszej organizacji. Jesteśmy globalną firmą farmaceutyczną z ponad 230-letnią historią. Najważniejsza dla Takedy jest poprawa zdrowia pacjentów na całym świecie, dlatego każdego dnia pracujemy z pasją, by osiągać ten cel. Zatrudnienie w Takedzie oznacza pracę w prestiżowej, rozpoznawalnej organizacji. W naszej firmie dbamy o przyjazną atmosferę, respektujemy prywatność pracowników i zachęcamy do zachowania równowagi między życiem zawodowym i prywatnym. Serdecznie zapraszamy do jednego z naszych biur, gdzie z przyjemnością opowiemy Ci, dlaczego warto dołączyć do Naszego zespołu.

Aktualnie do Zakładu Produkcyjnego w Łyszkowicach poszukujemy kandydatów na stanowisko Specjalista Kontroli Jakości.

Zakres Obowiązków
  • Samodzielne wykonywanie i ocenę badań chemicznych (badania chromatograficzne oraz badania fizykochemiczne) w celu dostarczania informacji o jakości badanych surowców, leków, materiałów opakowaniowych w oparciu o normy, specyfikacje, farmakopeę, zasady GMP i GLP
  • Przeprowadzenie działań wyjaśniających w przypadku uzyskania wyniku nietypowego, niezgodnego ze specyfikacją
  • Prowadzenie dokumentacji analitycznej
  • Nadzorowanie wykonywania badań chemicznych i sprawdzanie raportów z walidacji i kwalifikacji
  • Opiniowanie i sprawdzanie instrukcji, procedur oraz raportów z badań
  • Uczestnictwo w transferach metod analitycznych zewnętrznych oraz wewnętrznych
  • Przygotowywanie roztworów odczynników i wzorców oraz racjonalne ich wykorzystanie

Wymagania
  • Wykształcenie wyższe chemiczne, farmaceutyczne lub pokrewne
  • Minimum 2 lata doświadczenia w pracy na podobnym stanowisku w branży farmaceutycznej
  • Wiedza analityczna
  • Znajomość zagadnień z zakresu walidacji metod analitycznych
  • Znajomość technik analitycznych HPLC, GC, spektrofotometria (znajomość obszaru badań stabilności mile widziana)
  • Znajomość GMP oraz GLP
  • Znajomość obsługi pakietu MS Office
  • Znajomości języka angielskiego w stopniu komunikatywnym
  • Umiejętność współpracy w zespole
  • Umiejętność rozwiązywania problemów
  • Umiejętność organizacji pracy własnej oraz samodzielności

Oferujemy
  • Stabilne zatrudnienie
  • Pakiet socjalny (opieka medyczna, ubezpieczenie grupowe, dofinansowanie posiłków w stołówce zakładowej)
  • Ciekawą pracę w środowisku międzynarodowej firmy produkcyjnej

  • Dobrą atmosferę pracy

Join ABB and work in a team that is dedicated to creating a future where innovative digital technologies allow greater access to cleaner energy.

We are looking for a Opex Manager to join our Motion business in Electrical Motors, located in Aleksandrów Łódzki. In this role you will establish and maintain a Quality Culture within local ABB, by assuring and controlling systems, tools and teams to exceed customer expectations while ensuring sustainable operations. You will be in charge of developing & maintaining the Opex Management System of the local unit.


Your Responsibilities
  • Work with local management teams to prevent mistakes and defects in products and avoid problems when delivering solutions or services to customers; provide confidence that ABB and customer quality requirements will be fulfilled, focus on issue prevention rather than just control; establish customer and stakeholder needs/expectations; drive the utilization of process management across the local business to deliver consistent results, minimizing variation and maximizing efficiencies.
  • Ensure effective internal controls are in place to verify that processes continue to meet customer and stakeholder requirements. Validates that control plans are applied and effective in mitigating know risks.
  • Deploy and maintain the local Quality Management System to provide the local business with policies, regulations and processes that sufficiently describe the value chain activities.
  • Inspect and audit the manufacturing process, in accordance with the audit plan.
  • Lead the team during customers audit and factory tour.
  • Contribute to continuous improvement activities.
  • Promote collaboration between teams, help to train staff members.
  • Be aware and work to achieve the Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).
  • People management activities, coordinating a team in carrying out their daily tasks.

    • Your background
    • Bachelor or master degree in Electrical/Electronic or Industrial engineering.
    • Experience of at least 5 years in similar role.
    • Fluency in Polish and English.
    • Quality Management system (ISO9001), Failure Mode and Effect Analysis (FMEA).
    • Six Sigma and Statistical process control techniques, Problem Solving techniques (Ishikawa, 5 Whys).
    • Measurement system.
    • Understanding of engineering drawings and manufacturing processes.
    • More about us
    • Bring your very own sense of pride and purpose as you help us drive forward the Fourth Industrial Revolution – creating a sustainable future for our planet, and your career. Join ABB and harness the power of our diverse global network, as you collaborate with and learn from our world-class teams. Above all, challenge yourself every day. Let’s write the future, together.
    • Your benefits :
    • Enjoy a stable employment in a company with a long history in innovation and technology
    • Collaborate with experienced experts in an international environment
    • Seize individual development and training opportunities, from job specific to soft skills
    • Get private medical care (including offers for family members) and life insurance
    • Receive attractive remuneration based on your experience and skills, and other financial benefits, such as annual bonus and internal share purchase program
    • Choose from various benefits in kind, ranging from healthy lifestyle offerings, to knowledge sharing, to teambuilding activities

Join ABB and harness the power of our diverse global network, as you collaborate with and learn from our world-class teams. Above all, challenge yourself every day. Let’s write the future, together.

By clicking the “Apply” button, I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that I agree with Takeda’s Privacy Notice, Privacy Policy and Terms of Use.

Job Description

Are you looking for a patient-focused, innovation-driven company that will inspire you and empower you to shine? Join us as a Title in our Lodz office.

Here, you will be a vital contributor to our inspiring, bold mission.

A Typical Day Will Include

As a Business Partner working on the Newly formed Business Partner team, you will be empowered to build relationships and deliver value to the business. In this role, you will contribute to Takeda’s mission by offering innovative solutions to our stakeholders.
  • Establish an effective stakeholder management strategy for TBS, providing leadership to the Customer on solutions. Develops trusting relationships with the Local Finance leadership acquiring a thorough understanding of key customer needs and requirements, to deliver on their strategy.
  • Finding opportunities and optimizations to improve TBS Business Partner Services.
  • Provides leadership on the TBS Strategy aligned with the Customers’ Business Requirements.
  • Resolve any issues and problems faced by customers and handle escalations to maintain trust and improve the reputation of TBS and the supported business unit.

Accountabilities
  • Provides TBS leadership, implements and communicates to the Customer TBS strategy and operating plans that impact the countries within your responsibility.
  • Povides input to and influences the development of the TBS Strategy through the Country Finance Leaderhship, to implement process and technological improvements, that can provide buisness value to Takeda.
  • Demonstrates a deep understanding of how the Customer’s Function works and contributes to and acts as an extension of the local Finance Leadership team.
  • Utilising TBS business partnering methodology to provide regular status reports and forecasts to internal and external stakeholders, to drive and execute organisational and performance improvements.
  • Challenges existing best practices, interprets and communicate insights and drives and manages the development of business cases to support, improve and/or transform business and TBS solutions, processes and strategies.
  • Ensuring customer satisfaction with the service lines provided by TBS are maintained at agreed and acceptable levels by delivering on TBS commitments, to provide the correct solutions and services in a timely and efficient manner.
  • Single Point of Contact for the Customer in the event of escalations, ensuring issues are investigated and addressed proactively so that customer satisfaction is maintained, and financial and strategic targets achieved.
  • Expand the relationship by engaging with the business on new opportunities and provide appropriate solutions that build the TBS footprint whilst providing enterprise value.
  • Collaborate to co-create innovative solutions for driving the change within TBS and the Business, providing business guidance and support to the transformation activities.
  • Align between TBS or relevant project workstreams impacting the Area and enabling effective execution of projects.
  • Facilitate compliance with SOX and other corporate policies
  • Act as the face of TBS to the wider business/finance community, managing relationships with other functional and TBS pillars, jointly ensuring a positive business relationship

CORE ELEMENTS RELATED TO THIS ROLE
  • Experience of working in a customer centric environment, ideally shared services/business partnering
  • In-depth strategic and operational finance expereince
  • Working with multiple country commercial finance teams
  • Working with a couple of manufacturing site and understanding the GMS business and complexities involved
  • 3+ yrs Business Experience in a complex global environment, ideally including pharamaceutical industry experience
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Solutions mindset

TECHNICAL/FUNCTIONAL EXPERTISE
  • 7+ yrs in a Finance role with operational experience
  • Experience Working with multiple country commercial finance teams and ideally a manufacturing site

LEADERSHIP
  • Documented experience leading value improvement programs

DECISION-MAKING AND AUTONOMY
  • Well-developed problem-solving skills
  • Solutions oriented
  • Good understanding of how to facilitate decision making within Takeda’s Solutions Hub Operating Model and an ability to decipher when problems require escalation and the most appropriate route to resolution

INTERACTION
  • Employees of all levels and drawn from across the breadth of the Takeda Group
  • Colleagues across TBS

INNOVATION
  • Solutions minded thinker prepared to challenge existing practices and explore new ideas that are aligned to business priorities

COMPLEXITY
  • Engage with employees from all functions and levels across a breadth of subject and process areas, TBS Leadership and Senior Colleagues

Required Qualifications
  • Desirable: Master’s in Business Administration
  • Required: Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance
  • Proven experience as a business partner.
  • Strong functional and cross functional knowledge of TBS portfolio of offerings, in a global organisation.
  • Customer Centric and Solutions Orientated aptitude with demonstrable experience in providing solutions based on customer needs.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills with evident relationship building with professionals of all organizational levels.
  • Excellent organizational skills with proven success in a highly matrixed, fast paced and challenging business environment.
  • Ability to lead effectively and work concurrently across multiple priorities in a goal-oriented timeline-driven, and dynamic work environment, with quality and accuracy.
  • Enterprise mindset with proven skills in problem-solving and negotiation and understandingof the GMS business and complexities involved would be an advantage

Licenses/Certifications
  • Preferable: Fully Qualified Accountant (ACA, ACCA, CPA or equivalent), with 4 years post qualified experience

Physical Demands
  • Flexibility in working hours due to global nature and demands of the role and organisation

At Takeda, we are transforming the pharmaceutical industry through our R&D- driven market leadership and being a values-led company. To do this, we empower our people to realize their potential through life-changing work. Certified as a Global Top Employer, we offer stimulating careers, encourage innovation, and strive for excellence in everything we do. We foster an inclusive, collaborative workplace, in which our global teams are united by an unwavering commitment to deliver Better Health and a Brighter Future to people around the world.

position: Business Process Expert (BPE) Digital Service Interaction
whole_unnormalized_body:
In this role, you have the opportunity to

The role of Customer Self-Service Solutions Expert is a part of the Service Capability Design Team, which scope includes all Philips Business Systems elements for Service Delivery related activities that are involved in delivering quality services to customers. These activities include everything from a customer’s request for support, information, parts, consumables, technical/service, through to Customer Invoice, so full end to end service operations, and the associated processes.

You will be responsible for

  • define and realize opportunities in digitization of customer interaction to a ‘self help’ environment for areas like case management, parts/consumables purchasing, providing technical/service information, communication of Service Delivery Performance, contract Management and Reporting, T&M and Contract Billing, Knowledge Management / Self Service.
  • ‘Translation’ of these opportunities in business cases, requirements, features and user stories.
  • Ensure seamless integration of the solution with the back end processes.
  • Validating and testing the solution.
  • Assembling and leading global Design Reference Groups consisting of subject matter experts, fellow BPEs, Business Units and representatives from business units and marketing.
  • Interacting with teams within Philips working on other (portal/app) solutions to ensure a seamless customer experience.
  • Defining best practices inside Philips and in the market place.

You will be part of

A Team tasked with defining, developing and maintaining Customer Service processes & solutions within the Order2Cash scope and has overall process responsibility. The team also contributes to the Request2Resolution program by providing best in class processes, systems and other Philips Business Systems elements for the areas that have been identified as differentiators while providing fit for purpose industry standard processes and systems for those elements that have been identified as non-differentiating.

To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience

  • Minimum Bachelor’s degree preferred.
  • Previous experience in the areas of Service Operations, Process Management and Improvement, customer portal development.
  • Experience in development/implementation of self service solutions
  • Healthcare Sector (or other regulated industry) / capital goods and service industry or cross-sector project management experience would be a plus.
  • Excellent English communication skills both written and verbal
  • Knowledge of SalesForce.com/ServiceMax is nice to have
  • Additional continuous improvement discipline certifications (e.g. Lean, Six Sigma) desired

In return, we offer you

The unique combination of a critical and challenging role and a creative and empowering office environment. You will be actively encouraged to make improvements, establish best in class service and have a direct impact on the success of Philips on a daily basis.

  • Annual bonus based on performance achieved
  • Private medical care with option to extend it to family members
  • Benefit System cards
  • Discount for Philips’ products
  • Language courses
  • Relocation package applicable for people moving in from outside of Łódź region
  • Promotion of healthy lifestyle in the office (fruits twice / week in the office, gym, massage chairs, various events)

Why should you join Philips?

Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watching this video.

To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there, you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.

In this role, you have the opportunity to

Deliver transformational projects with global impact while helping to optimize and continually improve the Service Part Supply Chain (SPS) function within Philips Healthcare Services and Solutions Delivery organization.

You are responsible for

  • Managing strategic projects supporting the global SPS organization.
  • Management of logistics network deployments and optimizations.
  • IT system deployments
  • Implementing optimized supply chains.
  • Regulatory and Post Merger Integrations of systems

You are a part of

our Global Competence Center in Łódź, where we centralize our business processes. We bring together supporting roles within HR, Finance, Procurement, Customer Service, Supply Chain and other, enabling you to have a career in an international, cross functional environment. Your future colleagues speak 25+ languages and represent 15+ different nationalities, supporting our operations in 50 countries on a daily basis.

You will be part of Service Part Supply Chain (SPS) team responsible for ensuring that the right service part is delivered at the right location and time as requested by our customers. SPS project managers are highly motivated, experienced diverse global group frequently working internally with SPS as well as Business, Market and Function teams across Philips. In addition the team works with our external parties (UPS, Accenture, Sanmina)

To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience

  • A Bachelor’s degree
  • Minimum of 5 years’ experience in project management preferably in a Customer Service / Supply Chain environment
  • Experience with Logistics processes, working in a global role and dealing with 3rd parties preferred.
  • Flexibility regarding work timelines/business needs associated with working in a global team.
  • Excellent presentation skills with experience of presenting to senior management
  • PMP Certified Project Manager (preferred)
  • A results focused leader, enthusiastic and energetic, able to initiate and drive changes to completion.
  • The ability to set goals and leverage strong communication skills to motivate a multi-disciplinary, global team
  • Willing to travel globally up to 20% of time
  • Fluency in written/spoken English

In return, we offer you

The unique combination of a critical and challenging role and a creative and empowering office environment. You will be actively encouraged to make improvements, establish best in class service and have a direct impact on the success of Philips on a daily basis.

  • Annual bonus based on performance achieved
  • Private medical care with option to extend it to family members
  • Benefit System cards
  • Discount for Philips’ products
  • Language courses
  • Relocation package applicable for people moving in from outside of Łódź region
  • Promotion of healthy lifestyle in the office (fruits twice / week in the office, gym, massage chairs, various events)

Why should you join Philips?

Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watching this video.

Once there,you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.

In this role, you have the opportunity to

provide operational support to our healthcare customers on daily basis for back office Customer Service department in multinational environment, covering administrative activities.

You are responsible for

Parts:

  • Receiving POs from customer and Service Engineers for spare parts
  • Processing POs in the system which end with automatic request to transportation department
  • Managing invoice disputes on customer requests including issuing credit & debit invoices
  • Informing customers about delays and interruptions with delivery
  • Managing customers queries for spare parts such as price requests or follow-up on PO status

Quotation:

  • Providing calculation on customer demands for paid maintenance services and repairs
  • Creating quotes for time and material
  • Initiating entitlement disputes on ad-hoc customer requests
  • Correcting & updating quotes based on actual work performed by Field Service Engineer

Service Operations:

  • Balancing conflicting demands in the area of business obligations
  • Receiving, monitoring, developing and dispatching Service Work Orders and assigning proper Field Service Engineers
  • Communicating and confirming with the customer the service operations

Contract:

  • Creating & renewing service contracts and extended warranties
  • Modifying existing contracts and extended warranties for appropriate services execution of pricing and billing information
  • Terminating contracts according to documentation received from stakeholders
  • Connecting the correct installed based products
  • Issuing invoices and credit/debit notes
  • Verifying customers entitlements on ad-hoc requests

Service work order and billing:

  • Resolving incomplete cases by correcting errors to ensure integration with financial processes
  • Coordinating with other departments activities necessary to complete end to end process
  • Issuing invoices and credit notes for contracts and time & material items
  • Key element to provide resolution to potential system errors

Installed base:

  • Registration of installed products based on sales orders and handover documents
  • Maintaining customer installed base for parts consumption and removal of defective items
  • Carrying out on daily basis analysis of data accuracy including providing data for field audits
  • Updating statuses of installed products e.g. scrapped, storage, dismantled, operational

Reverse:

  • Contacting end customers by phone (outbound calls) and email to agree return pickups
  • Verifying discrepancies with customer and agree to collect returnable parts
  • Arranging transportation of recovered goods with couriers and forwarders
  • Monitoring and updating database for arranged pickups and calls attempts

You are a part of

Global Competence Center in Łódź, where we centralize our transactional processes. We bring together supporting roles within HR, Finance, Procurement, Customer Service, Supply Chain and other, enabling you to have a career in an international, cross functional environment. Your future colleagues speak 25+ languages and represent 15+ different nationalities, supporting our operations in 50 countries on a daily basis.

In Customer Service – the most multilanguage department in GBS, you will have an opportunity to work with colleagues in various languages on multinational projects, where honest, professional, friendly atmosphere and sense of humor shape our culture.

To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience

  • Bachelor’s degree
  • Fluent English and French
  • Professional experience in fields related to in customer service or supply chain or accounting operations would be an asset
  • Comprehensive PC skills, knowledge of Excel and SAP
  • Problem solving mindset with ability to identify improvement opportunities
  • Interpersonal skills required in interactions with internal and external customers
  • Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment. Skill in prioritizing tasks required
  • Good organizational skills and aptitude for details

In return, we offer you

The unique combination of a critical and challenging role and a creative and empowering office environment. You will be actively encouraged to make improvements, establish best in class service and have a direct impact on the success of Philips on a daily basis.

  • Annual bonus based on performance achieved
  • Private medical care with option to extend it to family members
  • Benefit System cards
  • Discount for Philips’ products
  • Language courses
  • Relocation package applicable for people moving in from outside of Łódź region
  • Promotion of healthy lifestyle in the office (fruits twice / week in the office, gym, massage chairs, various events)

Why should you join Philips?

Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. In this role, you have the opportunity to

Join Supply Chain Management Department which function consists of three sub-teams responsible for end-to-end logistics of health technology equipment getting delivered to a medical facility: from the order to the arrival and installation.

You are responsible for (depending on a team)

  • Preparing daily meetings (lean daily management boards)
  • Processing shipment orders, monitoring and tracking the freight and managing the carriers
  • Supporting order management with creating and executing orders for EMEA customers
  • Validating customer plans for site planning department
  • Contact not only with the customers, but also with Philips factories

You are a part of

One of the three sub-teams: Order Management (OM) – manages orders for ultrasound machines and consumables (electrodes, paper, sensors, cuffs, cables etc.). Integral Warehousing & Distribution (IWD) – responsible for transport of the ordered machines. Site Planning (SP) – the team, consisting of architects, engineers and designers, cooperates with the hospitals in order to prepare the examination room for the installation of machines such as X-rays, MRs, CTs or IGTs.

To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience

  • Currently enrolled in the at least third year of University degree (Supply Chain-related studies would be an asset)
  • Available at least 25h/week (preferably >30h/week)
  • Quick learner
  • Fluent in spoken and written English
  • MS Office applications, including Excel intermediate knowledge
  • Good communication skills
  • Analytical mind with an eye for detail

In return, we offer you

  • Paid 6-months internship based on civil contract
  • Flexible working hours
  • Possibility to use English in everyday activities
  • Work with passionate insightful colleagues who share your drive to create superior customer experience
  • Building your career in an international company that brings innovations that matter to you
  • Fast-paced oriented work in international environment

Join ABB and work in a team that is dedicated to creating a future where innovative digital technologies allow greater access to cleaner energy.

Our goal is to create a supply base that works as an extended enterprise, creating value through continuous improvement in quality, technology and logistics, while optimizing cost and sustainability.

You will be a vital member of the Procurement & Logistics team. Reporting to the insert line manager, you will support the implementation, maintenance and compliance of Procurement & Logistics activities.


Your Responsibilities
  • Designing and implementing plans for local sourcing to reach set business targets and supporting regional and global sourcing initiatives;
  • Leading by example by demonstrating health, safety and environment best practices and business ethics in day-to-day operations, contract management and negotiations;
  • Applying and implementing PL standards, tools and processes in the Products Business Line to secure quality, on-time delivery, optimal cost and sustainability;
  • Delivering and participating in training programs on compliance and professional development;
  • Executing effective and transparent communication internally, externally and between different units and centers to drive cross-collaboration;
  • Standardizing processes and implementing routines as per global directives;
  • Living ABB’s core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues, and the business.

Your background
  • Professional Degree in Commercial Engineering;
  • More than 3 years of experience in trade/logistics, working as engineering with products, equipment and contractors, dispatch control (OTD), warehouse and inventory control;
  • Advanced English level;
  • Demonstrated experience with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) softwares and Standard Operating Procedures (SOP);
  • Advanced Excel knowledge.
  • More about us
  • Bring your very own sense of pride and purpose as you help us drive forward the Fourth Industrial Revolution – creating a sustainable future for our planet, and your career. Join ABB and harness the power of our diverse global network, as you collaborate with and learn from our world-class teams. Above all, challenge yourself every day. Let’s write the future, together.
  • Your benefits :
  • Enjoy a stable employment in a company with a long history in innovation and technology;
  • Collaborate with experienced experts in an international environment;
  • Seize individual development and training opportunities, from job specific to soft skills;
  • Get private medical care (including offers for family members) and life insurance;
  • Receive attractive remuneration based on your experience and skills, and other financial benefits, such as annual bonus and internal share purchase program;
  • Choose from various benefits in kind, ranging from healthy lifestyle offerings, to knowledge sharing, to teambuilding activities.
  • Apply now for this job and become our next Procurement and Logistics Specialist.
  • Important, please include in your CV the following passage:
  • “I hereby give consent for my personal data included in my application to be processed for the purposes of the recruitment process under the Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation)”.
  • “I also consent to processing of my personal data for the purposes of any future recruitment processes”.
  • We reserve the right to answer only to the chosen candidates.

More About Us
Bring your very own sense of pride and purpose as you help us drive forward the Fourth Industrial Revolution – creating a sustainable future for our planet, and your career. Join ABB and harness the power of our diverse global network, as you collaborate with and learn from our world-class teams. Above all, challenge yourself every day. Let’s write the future, together.
Industrial Solutions

Position: Specification & Certification Analyst
Based: Lodz, Poland
12 months contract

Main Responsibilities
  • Collecting, maintaining and processing raw material & packaging technical data in associated systems.
  • Approving Raw Materials and collecting approval from Regulatory, Food Safety, Supplier Quality, R&D
  • Proactively and reactively obtaining raw material information from suppliers to meet technical needs as required, in collaboration with Procurement, R&D and Supplier Quality
  • Populating data in a timely manner to ensure continuous production and that business needs are met.
  • Providing expertise to the stakeholders in relation to Raw Material & Packaging Data
  • Managing the dispatch and returning of specifications to and from suppliers, to ensure contractual data is in place within agreed time frames.
  • Acting as first point of contact for any technical queries related to Raw Material data
  • Supporting McCormick manufacturing sites during 3rd party audits.
  • Responsible for producing accurate performance KPI’s.
  • Providing weekly/ monthly reports/ updates on project progress to the Team Manager.
  • Preparing data searches and WU reports in a timely manner and appropriate accuracy
  • Actively participating in Raw Material & Packaging related projects
  • Proactively performing root cause analysis and generating process improvement ideas.


CANDIDATE PROFILE
  • High University diploma in Food Science related discipline
  • 1-year experience in Food industry.
  • Intermediate level of computer literacy (specifically Excel, SAP, Outlook and Lotus Notes desirable)
  • Good oral and written communication skills.
  • Proactive and flexible approach.
  • Organized, methodical, good attention to detail.
  • Able to prioritize and manage time effectively, with high sense of urgency.
  • Statistical skills and knowledge of problem-solving methodology are highly valued.
  • Ability to work effectively across the business functions, and work effectively as part of a team
  • Fluent English

Livingston Research delivers help and support to customers around the world since 2009.

We strive to help students facilitate learning and improve their performance through leading-edge technology, services, and data capabilities.

We build, launch and promote products and services to empower students in countries like US, Australia, UK and many other.

Now we are looking for smart and creative content writers to join our team.

Position involves researching and writing original texts on various topics in English. Depending on the area of interest, you can specialize in book reports, article/movie reviews, and analytical reports in various spheres.

Requirements
  • Fluent English
  • 3rd year of Bachelor program or higher
  • Ability to work at least 10 hours per week or more

Benefits
  • Competitive compensation with performance-based bonuses in USD;
  • Flexible schedule. You decide when and where you’d like to work!
  • No bossing around;
  • You are the boss, you choose the projects you’d like to work on;
  • Ability to combine this job with your current errands;
  • Expert help 24/7 with order-related questions;
  • Personal success manager, who will gladly assist you with non-order related questions.

HOW TO APPLY?

In order to APPLY for the position and join our freelance family, you are to:
  • Go to [span data-href="http://bit.ly/2CZjKhE"]http://bit.ly/2CZjKhE[/span]
  • Fill in your account data;
  • Go through a timed English test and show off your ability to produce great content!
Once you successfully pass these short tests, our Recruiting Team Member will get in touch with you within the next 3−4 business days.

In this role, you have the opportunity to

Join an exciting new Portfolio Management team, providing governance, direction and support to Projects in the Philips Services and Solutions organization. Become part of the Project Management Office, delivering a large scope of transformational programs with global impact, across all Philips process domains (Idea to Market, Market to Order and Order to Cash), all supporting our objective of creating great services, with outcome-based solutions.

You are responsible for

  • Providing enabling processes to support projects within the Services and Solutions Transformation Office Portfolio
  • Adopting and enhancing governance, controls, processes, practices and tools to guide projects
  • Applying and maturing standard project methodologies to ensure Projects deliver a complete package of Philips Excellence elements (processes/systems, people, capabilities/learning, performance and organization structure)
  • Supporting the Transformation Office to ensure appropriate coaching, mentoring, training, and certification of Program and Project Managers
  • Supporting management of complex project dependencies within the Transformation Office and throughout Philips
  • Guiding and monitoring the activities of projects in partnership with the responsible Project and Program Managers
  • Developing plans, schedules, budgets and deliverables within the Portfolio
  • When appropriate developing tools and practices to support specific project needs

    • You are a part of

    The Services and Solutions Transformation Office, a new team bringing together all service/solution related projects under a coordinated portfolio. You will join a team of PMO Managers, Project Managers and Program Managers each responsible for the delivery of defined scope within the portfolio. Key elements of the portfolio include customer self-service, catalog management, configure/price/quote, workforce management, service mobility, call management and knowledge management. Scope includes resources in multiple functions including R&D, Marketing, Business Process, IT, Philips University and Compliance. You will be joining a highly motived, experienced and dedicated global team; frequently working with different countries, cultures and timezones.

    To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience

  • Bachelors degree
  • Prior experience in operating within a Project Management Office
  • PMP or PRINCE2 certification (preferred)
  • Agile, Scrum or SAFe experience
  • Experience in implementing change, an aptitude for process/structure and the ability to manage through influence
  • Strong collaboration skills, with an aptitude to drive performance while managing complexity and ambiguity
  • 5+ years’ experience in a PMO and/or project management role

    • In return, we offer you

    An opportunity for your project management career to flourish, within a portfolio of unique scope and ambition. Philips is on a journey to harmonise and improve our services and solutions capability in every one of the 60+ countries in which we operate. Succeeding in this challange will provide exceptional experience in business transformation, which will be invaluable to your long-term career in project or program management. In return for your commitment to our ambition, we offer a package of benefits commensurate with our status as a global brand and a leader in health & well-being.

    Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watching this video.

position: Accounts Payable Processor for North America
whole_unnormalized_body:
Position: Accounts Payable Processor for North America

Based: Łódź

Do you have proven experience of working in an International Shared Service Centre environment? If so we would like to hear from you.

Reporting to US Accounts Payable Supervisor. This position will be responsible for validating incoming invoices for accuracy, matching invoices to appropriate purchase order and passing invoice through SAP system processes.

Main Responsibilities
  • Validating invoice images for accuracy and identifying missing information.
  • Identifying trends and recommending improvement opportunities.
  • Reviewing invoices for completeness (verifying vendor name, address, and vendor status to determine accuracy of currency/taxes).
  • Validating invoices to appropriate purchase order and line item details.
  • Processing invoices through error resolutions with Business Partners/Vendors.
  • Routing of invoices to the business units for coding and approval when needed.
  • Routing of invoices with discrepancies to AP analysts for problem resolution when required.
  • Posting invoices within the SAP system.


CANDIDATE PROFILE
  • Ability to work in a two-shift system: 1st shift starting between 7-10am, and the 2nd shift starting between 12-14pm – one week per month.
  • High School diploma or equivalent required; college education preferred.
  • Prior work experience/knowledge of Accounts Payable preferred.
  • Excellent attention to detail and high degree of accuracy in all work required.
  • Proficient in the use of Microsoft applications. Some SAP experience preferred.
  • Demonstrated team orientation with strong customer service focus required.
  • Accuracy in Data entry skills.
  • Effective and Professional verbal and written communication skills.
  • Good command of English

Prosimy o dopisanie następującej klauzuli: „Wyrażam zgodę na przetwarzanie moich danych osobowych przez AMEET Sp. z o.o. z siedzibą w Łodzi, zwaną dalej „Administratorem”, w celu prowadzonego przez Administratora procesu rekrutacyjnego.

Moja zgoda dotyczy tych wszystkich danych osobowych, które zostały przeze mnie dobrowolnie podane, a które nie znajdują się w katalogu danych, których może żądać przyszły pracodawca, o których mowa w art. 22(1)
  • 1 kodeksu pracy [ tj. 1) imię (imiona) i nazwisko; 2) imiona rodziców; 3) datę urodzenia; 4) miejsce zamieszkania (adres do korespondencji); 5) wykształcenie; 6) przebieg dotychczasowego zatrudnienia].

    W dowolnym momencie mogę cofnąć moją zgodę. Wycofanie zgody nie wpływa na zgodność z prawem przetwarzania, którego dokonano na podstawie zgody przed jej wycofaniem.

    Wyrażam również zgodę na przetwarzanie wszystkich podanych przeze mnie danych na potrzeby przyszłych rekrutacji prowadzonych przez Administratora.”

    Przed wysłaniem aplikacji, prosimy o zapoznanie się z klauzulą informacyjną:
Company Name: Strona www AMEET Sp. z o.o.
