whole_unnormalized_body:
Philips is a diversified Health and Well-being company, focused on improving people’s lives through timely innovations. As a world leader in healthcare and lifestyle, Philips integrates technologies and design into people-centric solutions, based on fundamental customer insights.

As a Administration & Payroll Specialist you will have the opportunity to use your communication skills to help colleagues with HR related questions. You will be the contact point for General Management, HR managers and Employees.

You are a part of our Global Competence Center in Łódź, where we centralize our business processes. We bring together supporting roles within HR, Finance, Procurement, Customer Service, Supply Chain and other, enabling you to have a career in an international, cross functional environment. Your future colleagues speak 25+ languages and represent 15+ different nationalities, supporting our operations in 50 countries on a daily basis.

Your team:

Philips People Services (PPS) is the organization delivering common HR administrative & payroll services to Philips employees, managers and HR business partners, according to world class standards, in line with business requirements, leveraging PPS Centers and cooperating with external partners; thus leading to increased customer satisfaction and lower cost.

The Philips People Services Center Europe is based in Łódź, Poland and is part of Philips People Services. PPS is the Human Resources Shared Services organization of Philips. A team of HR professionals delivering HR Services to Philips employees and managers at all stages of the career cycle. PPS delivers cost-effective people services by leveraging economies of scale, globalizing processes and simplifying the ways of working, while delivering superior HR experiences by listening and acting on our customers’ feedback.

Your responsibilities:

  • Answering employees queries via e-mail or over the phone related to payroll (payslip queries), terms & conditions of employment, company benefits and HR processes.
  • Processing changes in employees’ employment lifecycle in accordance with country payroll calendar and global guidelines (new hire, transfer, termination, time & attendance, benefits, payroll) – data input to Workday, SAP HR.
  • Responsible for proper data input and for necessary corrections in the HR systems (Workday, SAP HR).
  • Preparing respective employment documentation (e.g. offer letter, contract, leaver letter, certificates, etc.)
  • Running admin & payroll reports (Workday, SAP HR).
  • Liaising with HR Managers, Reward Partners and line managers in order to investigate particular employees’ cases.
  • Support role for line managers to guide on how business processes should be handled by them in Workday in accordance with global guidelines.
  • Collaboration with vendors, external providers and other supporting departments (benefits provider, IT department, finance, etc.)
  • Collaboration with members of country local team on HR related topics.
  • Opportunity to participate in regional/global improvement projects.
  • Deliver sound customer solutions.

We are looking for people with:

  • Graduate with Bachelor degree
  • Fluent knowledge of Polish and English language (both orally and in writing)
  • Knowledge and understanding of HR processes and policies
  • Good knowledge of Polish labour law
  • Experience in HR/ personnel administration is a plus
  • SAP HR/Workday system knowledge is a plus
  • Detail oriented
  • Ability to effectively prioritize and organize workload, multi-task is essential
  • Personal integrity when handling confidential information
  • Ability to work in a changing environment to meet demanding deadlines and timescales
  • Excellent teamwork skills and ability to work independently
  • Effective listening and highly developed interpersonal skills

We offer:

The unique combination of a critical and challenging role and a creative and empowering office environment. You will be actively encouraged to make improvements, establish best in class service and have a direct impact on the success of Philips on a daily basis.

  • Annual bonus based on performance achieved
  • Private medical care with option to extend it to family members
  • Benefit System cards
  • Discount for Philips’ products
  • Language courses
  • Relocation package applicable for people moving in from outside of Łódź region
  • Promotion of healthy lifestyle in the office (fruits twice / week in the office, gym, massage chairs, various events)

Why should you join Philips?

Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways.

To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there, you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.

Join ABB and work in a team that is dedicated to creating a future where innovative digital technologies allow greater access to cleaner energy.

We are currently looking for candidate for the position of Supplier Development Specialist. The person hired for this position will be mainly responsible for activities related to audit of suppliers and maintenance of high quality of suppliers.


Your Responsibilities
  • Developing and continuous improvement of suppliers processes and quality management process.
  • Taking care for the development and optimization projects with selected suppliers.
  • Risk management - monitoring and taking preventive and corrective actions in order to avoid or minimalize any negative issues related to the quality of suppliers.
  • Verification of suppliers, management of periodic supplier audits.

Your background
  • Higher University degree (preferably technical).
  • Minimum 2 years of experience in similar positions or different positions in Quality Department or Process Development Department (nice to have: experiences in Supplier Audit and Development).
  • Knowledge of issues related to supply chain management, quality areas and audits.
  • Ability to read technical drawings.
  • Knowledge of Lean / Six Sigma methodology.
  • Very good knowledge of English.
  • Analytical thinking and creativity in solving problems.
  • Good communication skills, personal commitment and ability to work as a team member.
  • First experience in Lean Management.
  • Willingness to travel (20 to 30%).

More About Us
Bring your very own sense of pride and purpose as you help us drive forward the Fourth Industrial Revolution – creating a sustainable future for our planet, and your career. Join ABB and harness the power of our diverse global network, as you collaborate with and learn from our world-class teams. Above all, challenge yourself every day. Let’s write the future, together.

We offer:
  • Interesting work in a company focused on innovative solutions and modern technologies.
  • Possibility of development and raising professional qualifications.
  • Package of non-wage benefits.
  • Nice atmosphere and partnership relations at work.
To apply for the position, please send your application via our web page.

We reserve the right to answer only to the chosen candidates.

Position: Accounts Receivable Analyst with Portuguese

Based: Łódź, Poland

Main Responsibilities
  • Deduction management and resolution
  • Root cause analysis and issue resolution
  • Customer Service, sales team and customer interface
  • Process improvements
  • Understand customer deals/pricing and load/maintain customer contracts
  • Application of cash and processing customer remittances
  • Providing support for the other team members when needed (as assigned by the supervisor)
  • Meet operational metric targets
  • Participate in small projects


CANDIDATE PROFILE
  • Very good level of Portuguese and English
  • Business Administration, Accounting, Finance Degree or equivalent
  • Minimum 1 year of experience in credit, accounting, customer services or related field
  • Ability to synthesize financial information and present logical recommendations
  • Proficient in the use of Microsoft applications, SAP experience preferred
  • Demonstrated ability to exercise good judgment in high pressure, sensitive situations
  • Demonstrated problem solving skills
  • Good communication skills
  • Thorough understanding of business, processes, systems and internal controls
  • Ability to identify, manage and implement small process improvements
  • Ability to work effectively with internal and external customers at all levels

Join ABB and work in a team that is dedicated to creating a future where innovative digital technologies allow greater access to cleaner energy.

Industrial Solutions empowers smarter business operations by connecting equipment, software, and
services to protect, control, and optimize assets within electrical infrastructures. Across multiple
energy-intensive industries, the business provides customers with end-to-end product and service
solutions that help ensure the reliability and protection of their electrical infrastructure.
The position holder belongs to the European Sourcing Organization.
The Sourcing Commodity Manager will be responsible to develop and execute a world class commodity strategy to achieve deflationary targets.
The employee will be responsible for one of direct materials commodities purchase by ABB Electrification Products Industrial Solutions within Team


Your Responsibilities
  • Develop a deep understanding of the usage of the commodity he/she is responsible for;
  • Understand market dynamics, follow market trends and drive costs out by managing supplier relationship;
  • Understand how to create a simple, realistic, reality-based customer-focused vision and can communicate this in a straightforward way to the key stakeholders and the wider sourcing team;
  • Can present and advocate the sourcing case to a variety of audiences with self-confidence;
  • Can drive conclusions and decisions in relation related to sourcing;
  • Develop regional preferred suppliers (vendor consolidation), identify global cost opportunities, work with sourcing associates from other ABB businesses all over the word and leverage resources;
  • Facilitate meetings and workout sessions with cross-functional teams on sourcing topics;
  • Influence decisions and develop agreement with regards to NPI, manufacturing, engineering and services;
  • Involve all key stakeholders and members of the sourcing team;
  • Understand the resistance to the changes in sourcing and knows what it takes to change an organization culture;
  • Drive existing projects and identify new cost out opportunities;
  • Provide financial estimations about managed commodity, manage inflation / deflation report;
  • Maintain supplier data (prices, payment terms, lead-times) in SAP;
  • Maintains records of all assessments, communications and agreements with suppliers, make sure these records are easily accessible;
  • Ensure 2- way communication with business leadership on sourcing matters;
  • Apply a variety of tactics moving the negotiations further, while maintaining a positiv environment and supplier relationships;
  • Understands the commercial law codes & requirements in supplier agreements.

Your background
  • Bachelor of Science/Bachelor in Business;
  • An Engineering background would be an advantage;
  • Strong sourcing experience (or equivalent).
  • Fluent in written and spoken English;
  • Additional languages would be an advantage;

More About Us
Bring your very own sense of pride and purpose as you help us drive forward the Fourth Industrial Revolution – creating a sustainable future for our planet, and your career. Join ABB and harness the power of our diverse global network, as you collaborate with and learn from our world-class teams. Above all, challenge yourself every day. Let’s write the future, together.

We offer:
  • An interesting job in a company promoting innovative and modern technologies;
  • Opportunity for professional development in an international environment and for increasing your abilities and skills in
various areas;
  • Employment in a stable company with an established position in the market;
  • Attractive salary based on your professional experience and skills;
  • Good working environment.
Talent Partner leading recruitment process: Joanna Malarczyk

To apply for the position, please send your application via our page.

We reserve the right to answer only to the chosen candidates.

We kindly ask you to include in the Curriculum Vitae the following passage:

“I hereby give consent for my personal data included in my application to be processed for the purposes of the recruitment process under the Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation)”.

“I also consent to processing of my personal data for the purposes of any future recruitment processes”.
Industrial Solutions

By clicking the “Apply” button, I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that I agree with Takeda’s Privacy Notice, Privacy Policy and Terms of Use.

Job Description

Takeda is a patient-focused, innovation-driven global pharmaceutical company that builds on a distinguished 238-year history, aspiring to bring better health and a brighter future for people worldwide. Our network spans over 80 countries and regions worldwide and Takeda’s pharmaceutical products are marketed in over 100 countries worldwide.

Takeda Business Solutions (TBS) is a newly formed function within Takeda with the objective of enabling Takeda’s business strategy, delivering simplification and cost reduction, improving service and providing a transformation engine for continuous improvement for Takeda. ‘Building and Delivering Simplified and Innovative Solutions’ is our overarching vision with a goal of ‘Patient Centricity’, helping focus us on delivering value for Takeda.

As a Treasury / Payment Factory (IHB) Specialist you will be responsible for:
  • External bank account management, including opening and KYC
  • External and internal payment processing (in online banking and via H2H connectivity)
  • Ownership and management of In-House Bank
  • Treasury accounting
  • Money Market management (FX, SWAP points)
  • Daily cash monitoring and disposition
  • Reporting
  • Treasury Back and Middle office functions

Required Qualifications
  • Background in Finance and Accounting area

What Takeda Can Offer You

  • We take care of your appetite - delicious meals in the canteen, meals delivery service, fresh fruits,
  • We take care of your comfort - quiet, cozy office with creative corner and chillout zones, integration trips and events,
  • We take care of your development - language courses and trainings, Takeda Running Team and corporate volunteering

Position: Accounts Payable Processor

Based: Łódź, Poland

Are you looking to start your professional career in Finance? Would you like to develop in an international environment? If yes, then we’re looking for you!

Main Responsibilities
  • Validating scanned images for accuracy and/or missing information
  • Identifying trends and recommending improvement opportunities
  • Reviewing invoices for completeness (verifying vendor name, address, and vendor status to determine accuracy of currency/taxes)
  • Matching invoices to appropriate purchase order and line item detail
  • Routing of invoices to the business units for coding and approval
  • Routing of invoices with discrepancies to AP analysts for problem resolution
  • Booking invoices in SAP system


Candidate Profile
  • High School diploma or equivalent required; some college education preferred
  • Good command of English, knowledge of French will be an advantage
  • Prior work experience in Accounts Payable preferred
  • Excellent attention to detail and high degree of accuracy in all work required
  • Proficient in the use of Microsoft applications. Some SAP experience preferred
  • Demonstrated team orientation with strong customer service focus required
  • Effective verbal and written communication skills required
  • Proven data entry skills required

job_description_details.Industry: Food & Beverages Food Production Consumer Goods

whole_unnormalized_body:
Your Challenge
In the role of Global Process Program Lead, you will be responsible to optimize global process harmonization towards best practice processes among all “quote to invoice” teams globally. You report into Supply Chain Service Lead and are part of supply chain leadership team.

Department & Team

Quote to Invoice process is a critical part of GBS supply chain operations and responsible for managing customer orders from order acceptance up to delivery to customers of Philips Healthtech globally. As part of the drive towards GBS North Star to become strategic partner for Businesses, Markets and Function, cross-hub process standardization, improvement and simplification are prerequisites for optimal execution. You will play vital role to make it happen.

Responsibilities

In the role of Process Program lead your main responsibilities include:

  • Identify “Quote to Invoice” best practices to drive for best in class service operations with better customer experience on a global level (at lower delivery cost).
  • Challenge, but also help to get selected processes towards benchmark level.
  • Drive to copy and implement these best practices towards all GBS hubs globally.
  • Monitor the common Key Performance indicators of Quote to Invoice making sure necessary corrective actions are taken to steer and correct.
  • Optimize execution of supply chain processes in line with GBS strategy
  • Coordinate cross-hub process standardization, improvement and simplification teaming up with B/M value stream leaders and hub operations in GBS and Partners as well as Functions to deliver a harmonized global process design blueprint that meets Philips Excellence Process Framework standards.
  • Steer the right process applicable to Business, Market and Function in PEPF

We are looking for

  • Master degree with 5-10 years experience or a Bachelor degree with 10+ years.
  • Knowledge of supply chain management / business administration.
  • Deep knowledge of Philips Sales Back Office and Order Management processes is a very strong plus.
  • SAP experience or other ERP system.
  • Hands-on experience with Lean techniques and culture.
  • Project management skills.
  • Process thinking.
  • Improvement skills/attitude.
  • People management skills.
  • Good communication skills at different levels.
  • Strong cultural awareness.
  • Fluent in English.

In return, we offer you

The unique combination of a critical and challenging role and a creative and empowering office environment. You will be actively encouraged to make improvements, establish best in class service and have a direct impact on the success of Philips on a daily basis.

  • Annual bonus based on performance achieved
  • Private medical care with option to extend it to family members
  • Benefit System cards
  • Discount for Philips’ products
  • Language courses
  • Relocation package applicable for people moving in from outside of Łódź region
  • Promotion of healthy lifestyle in the office (fruits twice / week in the office, gym, massage chairs, various events)

Dołącz do firmy ABB i podejmij pracę w zespole mającym wpływ na tworzenie przyszłości, w której innowacyjne technologie cyfrowe będą zapewniały większy dostęp do czystszej energii.

Obecnie poszukujemy kandydatów na stanowisko Koordynatora ds. Kluczowych Klientów. Osoba zatrudniona na tym stanowisku będzie odpowiedzialna za współpracę z Klientami w zakresie sprzedaży produktów ABB, linii biznesowej Motion (Układy Napędowe i Silniki Elektryczne). Lokalizacja: Aleksandrów Łódzki/ Warszawa

Twoje obowiązki
  • Zapewnienie wysokiego poziomu obsługi Klientów;
  • Inicjowanie, rozwijanie i utrzymywanie relacji z Klientami;
  • Zapewnienie dostępu obecnym i potencjalnym Klientom do materiałów informacyjnych;
  • Pozyskiwanie i analiza zapytań ofertowych;
  • Wybór rozwiązania technicznego we współpracy z Działem Technicznym;
  • Analiza potrzeb rynku pod kątem oczekiwanych cech i parametrów produktu;
  • Śledzenie postępu technicznego oraz inicjowanie prac doskonalących rozwiązania produktu;
  • Prowadzenie prezentacji produktowych;
  • Udział w inicjatywach globalnych i lokalnych pod kątem sprzedażowym;
  • Koordynowanie współpracy jednostek sprzedażowych z jednostkami produkcyjnymi.

    • Twoje kompetencje
  • Wykształcenie wyższe, preferowane techniczne;
  • Ogólna znajomość zagadnień z obszaru elektrotechniki i energoelektroniki;
  • Preferowane doświadczenie z pracy z Klientem Przemysłowym i Producentami Maszyn;
  • Doświadczenie w pracy na podobnym stanowisku;
  • Bardzo dobra znajomość języka angielskiego;
  • Analityczność, otwartość, łatwość uczenia się;
  • Samodzielność, samodyscyplina i dobra organizacja pracy;
  • Prawo jazdy kat. B.

    • Więcej o nas
    Wnieś swoje własne poczucie dumy i celu, pomagając nam rozwijać Czwartą Rewolucję Przemysłową – tworząc zrównoważoną przyszłość naszej planety i Twojej kariery. Dołącz do ABB i wykorzystaj siłę naszej zróżnicowanej globalnej sieci, współpracując i ucząc się od naszych światowej klasy zespołów. Przede wszystkim stawiaj sobie wyzwanie każdego dnia. Napiszmy przyszłość razem.

    Oferujemy:

  • Ciekawą pracę w zakładzie nastawionym na innowacyjne rozwiązania i nowoczesne technologie.
  • Możliwość rozwoju i podnoszenia kwalifikacji zawodowych.
  • Pakiet benefitów pozapłacowych.
  • Miłą atmosferę i partnerskie stosunki w pracy.

whole_unnormalized_body:
As a TA Coordinator, you will be responsible for

  • Proactively support TA team in their daily tasks
  • Full organization of job interview between candidates and business members of Royal Philips
  • Scheduling business interviews directly in the Outlook of interviewers
  • Confirming the interview to candidates
  • Book and arrange all facilities like rooms on location and skype connections
  • Continuous elaboration with recruiters in planning the interviews as quickly as possible
  • Deliver administrative support in organizing recruitment events on campus

To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience

  • Student of at least II year of studies
  • Fluent English (both orally and in writing)
  • Knowledge of any other European language will be an asset (German, Spanish, Italian, French, Russian)
  • Computer literacy (MS Windows, MS office) is essential
  • Ability to effectively prioritize and organize workload
  • Personal integrity when handling confidential information

In return, we offer you

  • Paid 6 months internship based on civil contract
  • Flexible working hours
  • Possibility to use English in everyday activities
  • Building your career in an international company that brings innovations that matter to you
  • Fast-paced oriented work in an international environment

    • Why should you join Philips?

    Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watching this video.

    To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there, you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.

Join ABB and work in a team that is dedicated to creating a future where innovative digital technologies allow greater access to cleaner energy.

We are an international pioneering technology leader that is writing the future of industrial digitalization. One of our key ambitions is to get faster and leaner, and to move closer to the customer. Therefore, we are building up a Center of Expertise which in addition to Finance Business Partners and GBS Finance is one of the three key pillars of our service delivery model. The Finance Controlling & Planning CoE has the responsibility, working closely with the division and country organizations to: # Drive Controlling & Planning standardization. To strengthen our CoE team, we are looking for a self-driven Senior Specialist with a process improvement approach. Seize this unique opportunity to take an active part in shaping our new CoE center and grow together with the rapidly developing organization.


Your Responsibilities

As a Controlling & Planning Analyst, you will be responsible for the following:

Business Analysis
  • Perform analysis of business performance versus budget and forecast
  • Prepare various financial analysis (eg. cost / benefit analysis, inventories and NWC, overhead under / over absorption, Product / Customer profitability)
Financial reporting
  • Support preparation of relevant organization financial reporting, business planning, budgeting and forecasting and validate accuracy of financial data and business information and reports by performing reconciliation and review of exceptions
Information and communication
  • Provide information to management by assembling and summarizing data, preparing reports, presentation of findings and analysis
Optimization
  • Optimize own performance to increase productivity, recommend changes of process standards and procedures
Internal control and documentation
  • Maintain proper audit trail and documentation and ensure SOPs are prepared and updated regularly

Your background
  • Minimum +2 years of experience in Controlling and/or FP&A
  • Bachelor Degree in Finance and Accounting or Business administration.
  • Understanding of end-to-end process, systems and data flows across organization and experience in IT systems: ERP, Planning & Reporting tools and integrated solutions.
  • Good communication skills and ability to interact with process stakeholders at various levels.
  • Good problem solving and analytical skills, ability to prioritize tasks, demonstrated ability to achieve objectives and focus on details
  • Strong MS Office skills.
  • Fluent in English.

More About Us
Your benefits:
  • Enjoy a stable employment in a company with a long history in innovation and technology
  • Collaborate with experienced experts in an international environment
  • Seize individual development and training opportunities, from job specific to soft skills
  • Get private medical care (including offers for family members) and life insurance
  • Receive attractive remuneration based on your experience and skills, and other financial benefits, such as annual bonus and internal share purchase program
  • Choose from various benefits in kind, ranging from healthy lifestyle offerings, to knowledge sharing, to teambuilding activities
Apply now for this job and become our next Controlling & Planning Analyst

Important, please include in your CV the following passage:

“I hereby give consent for my personal data included in my application to be processed for the purposes of the recruitment process under the Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation)”.

“I also consent to processing of my personal data for the purposes of any future recruitment processes”.

Dołącz do firmy ABB i podejmij pracę w zespole mającym wpływ na tworzenie przyszłości, w której innowacyjne technologie cyfrowe będą zapewniały większy dostęp do czystszej energii.

Dołącz do naszego zespołu w Zakładzie Transformatorów Dystrybucyjnych i pracuj jako Inżynier Procesu -Automatyk. Do Twoich obowiązków będzie należało nadzorowanie, modyfikowanie i udoskonalanie przebiegu procesu produkcyjnego.

Twoje obowiązki
  • Nadzór nad technologią i procesem produkcji.
  • Udoskonalanie i optymalizacja istniejących procesów poprzez automatyzację procesu produkcji oraz wprowadzanie działań usprawniających (Lean, Kaizen, DMAIC).
  • Wdrażanie nowych maszyn i urządzeń zgodnie ze specyfikacją – realizacja projektów inwestycyjnych.
  • Identyfikacja, analiza i rozwiązywanie problemów procesowych na produkcji.
  • Przygotowywanie dokumentacji procesowej.
  • Monitorowanie i analizowanie wskaźników produkcyjnych.
  • Ścisła współpraca z dostawcami zewnętrznymi oraz działami fabrycznymi.

    • Twoje kompetencje
  • Wykształcenie wyższe techniczne (kierunek Automatyka).
  • Minimum 2 lata doświadczenia na podobnym stanowisku.
  • Dobra znajomość języka angielskiego, umożliwiająca swobodna komunikacje w międzynarodowym środowisku.
  • Udział w projektach modernizacji maszyn, doświadczenie w tworzeniu specyfikacji technicznych dla projektów inwestycyjnych.
  • Umiejętność zarządzania projektami wdrożeniowymi i optymalizacyjnymi, znajomość metodologii Lean Manufacturing.
  • Biegłość w posługiwaniu się pakietem MS Office, mile widziana znajomość SAP.
  • Kreatywność, umiejętność analitycznego myślenia.
  • Zorientowanie na cele i rozwiązywanie problemów.

    • Więcej o nas
    Wnieś swoje własne poczucie dumy i celu, pomagając nam rozwijać Czwartą Rewolucję Przemysłową – tworząc zrównoważoną przyszłość naszej planety i Twojej kariery. Dołącz do ABB i wykorzystaj siłę naszej zróżnicowanej globalnej sieci, współpracując i ucząc się od naszych światowej klasy zespołów. Przede wszystkim stawiaj sobie wyzwanie każdego dnia. Napiszmy przyszłość razem.

    To wyjątkowy moment na dołączenie do ABB Power Grids. ABB i Hitachi podpisały porozumienie o utworzeniu spółki joint venture (JV). Chcemy stać się nowym światowym liderem w sektorze energetyki dzięki wykorzystaniu mocnych stron obu firm. ABB Power Grids i Hitachi to w sumie 230 lat tradycji i doświadczenia na rynku. Razem będziemy w stanie kształtować przyszłość energetyki za pomocą pionierskich technologii i staniemy się preferowanym partnerem w budowaniu mocniejszej, bardziej inteligentnej i ekologicznej sieci energetycznej. Proces tworzenia jednej spółki ma zostać zakończony w pierwszej połowie 2020 roku, po otrzymaniu wymaganych zezwoleń. Przyłącz się do tej pasjonującej podróży.

    Oferujemy:

  • Interesującą pracę w firmie nastawionej na innowacyjne rozwiązania i nowoczesne technologie.
  • Stabilność zatrudnienia w firmie o ugruntowanej pozycji rynkowej.
  • Możliwość rozwoju zawodowego w międzynarodowym środowisku i podnoszenia kwalifikacji zawodowych.
  • Atrakcyjny pakiet benefitów (Prywatna opieka medyczna, karta Multisport, ubezpieczenie na życie).

    Równocześnie zastrzegamy sobie prawo odpowiedzi wyłącznie na wybrane oferty.

    Wszystkie oferty powinny zawierać klauzulę: „Wyrażam zgodę na przetwarzanie moich danych osobowych w celu rekrutacji zgodnie z art. 6 ust. 1 lit. a Rozporządzenia Parlamentu Europejskiego i Rady (UE) 2016/679 z dnia 27 kwietnia 2016 r. w sprawie ochrony osób fizycznych w związku z przetwarzaniem danych osobowych i w sprawie swobodnego przepływu takich danych oraz uchylenia dyrektywy 95/46/WE (ogólne rozporządzenie o ochronie danych)”.

    „Wyrażam również zgodę na przetwarzanie moich danych osobowych w celu prowadzenia przyszłych rekrutacji”.

Obowiązki

PRZYGOTOWANIE FORM ODLEWNICZYCH, PRZENOSZENIE SKRZYNEK FORMIERSKICH, ZAGĘSZCZANIE, OBSŁUGA NARZĘDZI RĘCZNYCH, MASZYN I URZĄDZEŃ DO FORMOWANIA

In this role, you have the opportunity to

Become a part of Philips Finance which under the umbrella of Royal Philips manages and performs transactional finance activities for the company. We are now in the process of consolidating regional European P2P activities into one Hub in Łódź and we know that people are key to the success of this transition – join us in this exciting journey!

You are responsible for

  • Daily cooperation in multinational environment
  • Investigating root causes of issues, proposing (and implementing) solutions
  • Reporting and following up assigned issues
  • Preparing charts for daily operational meetings
  • Finding the necessary information for invoices pre-entered into the system
  • Helping with clearing the debit balances on vendor accounts
  • Participation in an exciting project within which we are transferring several companies to one system
  • Preparing updates of files and manuals for external partners

To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience

  • Currently enrolled in the at least third year of University degree (Economic or Finance-related studies would be an asset)
  • Available at least 25h/week (preferably >30h/week)
  • Quick learner
  • Fluent in spoken and written English
  • MS Office applications, including Excel intermediate knowledge
  • Good communication skills
  • Analytical mind with an eye for detail

In return, we offer you

  • Paid 6-months internship based on civil contract
  • Flexible working hours
  • Possibility to use English in everyday activities
  • Work with passionate insightful colleagues who share your drive to create superior customer experience
  • Building your career in an international company that brings innovations that matter to you
  • Fast-paced oriented work in international environment

Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watching this video.

To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there,you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.

Dołącz do firmy ABB i podejmij pracę w zespole mającym wpływ na tworzenie przyszłości, w której innowacyjne technologie cyfrowe będą zapewniały większy dostęp do czystszej energii.

Łódzka fabryka ABB to największe centrum produkcyjne spółki w naszym kraju.
Pod jednym dachem, w pięciu zakładach, powstają transformatory mocy, rozdzielcze, trakcyjne oraz komponenty i elementy izolacyjne do produkcji transformatorów.
Zlokalizowany w Łodzi przy ulicy Aleksandrowskiej kompleks produkcyjny ABB zatrudnia ponad 1500 osób. Aktualnie do naszego Zakładu Transformatorów Mocy poszukujemy osób na stanowisko: Monter

Jeżeli jesteś osobą chętną do nauki, ambitną i zaangażowaną – APLIKUJ!

Zostań częścią naszego łódzkiego zespołu!

Twoje obowiązki
  • Realizacja zadań produkcyjnych;
  • Montaż elementów do transformatora;
  • Przestrzeganie przepisów BHP.

    • Twoje kompetencje
  • Wykształcenie min. zasadnicze zawodowe;
  • Umiejętność odczytania podstawowych informacji z rysunku technicznego;
  • Gotowość do podjęcia pracy w trybie 3 zmianowym.

    • Więcej o nas
    Wnieś swoje własne poczucie dumy i celu, pomagając nam rozwijać Czwartą Rewolucję Przemysłową – tworząc zrównoważoną przyszłość naszej planety i Twojej kariery. Dołącz do ABB i wykorzystaj siłę naszej zróżnicowanej globalnej sieci, współpracując i ucząc się od naszych światowej klasy zespołów. Przede wszystkim stawiaj sobie wyzwanie każdego dnia. Napiszmy przyszłość razem.

    Dołącz do nas i zyskaj:

  • Stabilne zatrudnienie i umowę o pracę zawartą bezpośrednio z ABB;
  • Wynagrodzenie miesięczne od 3000 zł brutto;
  • Ubezpieczenie Grupowe Generali oraz prywatną opiekę medyczną LuxMed;
  • Dofinansowanie do karty MultiSport, możliwość korzystania z ZFŚS
  • Premię roczną do 10% rocznego wynagrodzenia brutto;
  • Nagrody za polecenia nowych pracowników – od 1500 zł brutto;
  • Pakiet szkoleń – umożliwiamy zdobycie uprawnień UDT: suwnice, wózki widłowe;
  • Bezpieczne i przyjazne środowisko pracy - przede wszystkim dbamy o Twoje bezpieczeństwo.

    • Zastrzegamy sobie prawo odpowiedzi wyłącznie na wybrane oferty.

    Wszystkie oferty powinny zawierać klauzulę:„Wyrażam zgodę na przetwarzanie moich danych osobowych w celu rekrutacji zgodnie z art. 6 ust. 1 lit. a Rozporządzenia Parlamentu Europejskiego i Rady (UE) 2016/679 z dnia 27 kwietnia 2016 r. w sprawie ochrony osób fizycznych w związku z przetwarzaniem danych osobowych i w sprawie swobodnego przepływu takich danych oraz uchylenia dyrektywy 95/46/WE (ogólne rozporządzenie o ochronie danych)”.

    „Wyrażam również zgodę na przetwarzanie moich danych osobowych w celu prowadzenia przyszłych rekrutacji”.
    Transformers

In this role, you have the opportunity to

Deliver transformational projects with global impact while helping to optimize and continually improve the Service Part Supply Chain (SPS) function within Philips Healthcare Services and Solutions Delivery organization.

You are responsible for

  • Managing strategic projects supporting the global SPS organization.
  • Management of logistics network deployments and optimizations.
  • IT system deployments
  • Implementing optimized supply chains.
  • Regulatory and Post Merger Integrations of systems

You are a part of

our Global Competence Center in Łódź, where we centralize our business processes. We bring together supporting roles within HR, Finance, Procurement, Customer Service, Supply Chain and other, enabling you to have a career in an international, cross functional environment. Your future colleagues speak 25+ languages and represent 15+ different nationalities, supporting our operations in 50 countries on a daily basis.

You will be part of Service Part Supply Chain (SPS) team responsible for ensuring that the right service part is delivered at the right location and time as requested by our customers. SPS project managers are highly motivated, experienced diverse global group frequently working internally with SPS as well as Business, Market and Function teams across Philips. In addition the team works with our external parties (UPS, Accenture, Sanmina)

To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience

  • A Bachelor’s degree
  • Minimum of 5 years’ experience in project management preferably in a Customer Service / Supply Chain environment
  • Experience with Logistics processes, working in a global role and dealing with 3rd parties preferred.
  • Flexibility regarding work timelines/business needs associated with working in a global team.
  • Excellent presentation skills with experience of presenting to senior management
  • PMP Certified Project Manager (preferred)
  • A results focused leader, enthusiastic and energetic, able to initiate and drive changes to completion.
  • The ability to set goals and leverage strong communication skills to motivate a multi-disciplinary, global team
  • Willing to travel globally up to 20% of time
  • Fluency in written/spoken English

In return, we offer you

The unique combination of a critical and challenging role and a creative and empowering office environment. You will be actively encouraged to make improvements, establish best in class service and have a direct impact on the success of Philips on a daily basis.

  • Annual bonus based on performance achieved
  • Private medical care with option to extend it to family members
  • Benefit System cards
  • Discount for Philips’ products
  • Language courses
  • Relocation package applicable for people moving in from outside of Łódź region
  • Promotion of healthy lifestyle in the office (fruits twice / week in the office, gym, massage chairs, various events)

Why should you join Philips?

Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watching this video.

To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there,you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.

In this role, you have the opportunity to

Work within an international team, which is a global Purchase to Pay process owner: we design the process, improve it and introduce new tools. You will have a unique opportunity to works closely with the Project Manager, who is introducing a new, innovative tool for accounting area.

You are responsible for

  • Support on daily basis work of the Project Manager
  • Contact with vendors to influence the changes to improve automation
  • Investigating root causes of issues, proposing and implementing changes / solutions
  • Actively work to improve the automation solutions
  • Daily cooperation in a multinational environment

    • To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience

  • Student of at last 2nd year of Bachelor Degree studies (ideally related to Business, Economics, etc.)
  • Fluent English is a must (both orally and in writing)
  • Finance understanding or an interest in this area would be a great plus
  • Very good communication skill
  • MS Excel at a very good level
  • Fast learner eager to gain experience within an international company
  • Availability to work part-time, but every day
  • Good team player

    • In return, we offer you

  • Paid 6 months internship based on civil contract
  • Flexible working hours
  • Possibility to use English in everyday activities
  • Work with passionate insightful colleagues who share your drive to create a superior customer experience
  • Building your career in an international company that brings innovations that matter to you
  • Fast-paced oriented work in an international environment

Jesteśmy skandynawskim koncernem ochrony.
Pozycję lidera na światowym rynku zdobyliśmy dzięki pracownikom
oraz nowoczesnym zintegrowanym rozwiązaniom technicznym.
Do naszego zespołu poszukujemy obecnie kandydatów na stanowisko:
Koordynator Ochrony

Wyzwania, Jakie Na Ciebie Czekają
  • koordynowanie działań ochrony obiektów handlowych - poszukujemy 2óch Kandydatów na tereny województw: mazowieckiego i łódzkiego oraz łódzkiego i wielkopolskiego,
  • utrzymywanie pozytywnych relacji z klientami,
  • nadzór nad prawidłową realizacją usług i dbanie o ich wysoką jakość,
  • wdrażanie oraz szkolenie nowych pracowników,
  • prowadzenie dokumentacji związanej z zarządzaniem pracownikami i kontraktem,
  • kształtowanie pozytywnego wizerunku Securitas.
Oczekiwania, Jakie Mamy w Stosunku Do Ciebie
  • dobra znajomość branży ochrony osób i mienia,
  • wpis na listę Kwalifikowanych Pracowników Ochrony będzie dodatkowym atutem,
  • wykształcenie minimum średnie,
  • doświadczenie związane z ochroną obiektów handlowych,
  • doświadczenie w zarządzaniu (stanowisko Dowódcy, Szefa Obiektu itp.)
  • samodzielność, odpowiedzialność,
  • dyspozycyjność, odporność na stres,
  • wysoka kultura osobista,
  • dobra umiejętność obsługi komputera (MS Office),
  • prawo jazdy kat B,
  • niekaralność.
Ze Swojej Strony Oferujemy
  • stabilne warunki zatrudnienia (umowa o pracę),
  • stałe wynagrodzenie zasadnicze + premie uzależnione od wyników,
  • realne wsparcie przełożonych w codziennej pracy,
  • wszystkie potrzebne narzędzia pracy (samochód służbowy, laptop, smartfon),
  • ubezpieczenie NNW opłacone przez pracodawcę,
  • karnet sportowo-rekreacyjny,
  • pakiet medyczny,
  • dofinansowanie do nauki języka angielskiego,
  • przyjazną atmosferę bazującą na szacunku i współpracy,
  • możliwość awansu i rozwoju w strukturach firmy.

In this Regulatory Specialist role, you have the opportunity to support the regulatory team in ensuring compliance with product and device marking requirements within the Oral Healthcare team. This includes working under the direction of the regulatory team and with internal business groups, ensuring compliance to product regulatory requirements.

Your responsibilities going to be divided into two parts:

Artwork Review for format and content in vendor tool (SGS) per regulatory requirements. Perform additional product and documentation review tasks.

Support Philips labeling proces:

  • Create, edit and route regulatory graphics for product (type plates):

    • Using Adobe Illustrator with standard templates to create regulatory type plates.
    • Managing stakeholders and deadlines effectively.
  • Route specification documents for approval and release:

    • Using Philips Product Data Management system to process document routing.
  • Document and improve process in coordination with US team.

You are a part of

Our Global Competence Center in Łódź, where we centralize our business processes. We bring together supporting roles within HR, Finance, Procurement, Customer Service, Supply Chain and other, enabling you to have a career in an international, cross functional environment. Your future colleagues speak 25+ languages and represent 15+ different nationalities, supporting our operations in 50 countries on a daily basis.

You will be part of the Safety and Compliance Regulatory team, supporting regulatory definition and oversight for Philips products and related project needs within the regulatory team. The first business you will support is Philips Oral Health Care.

To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience

  • Fluent English language skills
  • Highly detail oriented and able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously
  • Quickly learner
  • Bachelor’s degree or relevant experience in the regulatory role
  • Minimum of 2 years of experience supporting regulatory compliance efforts
  • Exceptional communication skills for coordinating remote teams of many nationalities
  • Demonstrated proficiency with electronic record-keeping system
  • Microsoft Office experience, including Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and Notes
  • Adobe Acrobat experience for editing and annotating PDFs
  • Must be experienced with Adobe Illustrator (create, edit and layer management of product graphics for both text and icons)
  • Familiar with the use of Product Data Management (PDM) systems - highly preferred
  • Experience working in ISO 9000 / ISO 13485 or similar regulated business preferred

In return, we offer you

The unique combination of a critical and challenging role and a creative and empowering office environment. You will be actively encouraged to make improvements, establish best in class service and have a direct impact on the success of Philips on a daily basis.

  • Annual bonus based on performance achieved
  • Private medical care with option to extend it to family members
  • Benefit System cards
  • Discount for Philips’ products
  • Language courses
  • Relocation package applicable for people moving in from outside of Łódź region
  • Promotion of healthy lifestyle in the office (fruits twice / week in the office, gym, massage chairs, various events)

Do naszego Zakładu Transformatorów Mocy poszukujemy kandydatów na stanowisko Specjalisty ds. Planowania Produkcji. Osoba zatrudniona na tym stanowisku będzie odpowiedzialna za weryfikacje możliwości produkcyjnych zakładu oraz proces planowania produkcji.

Twoje obowiązki
  • Przygotowywanie krótko i długoterminowych planów produkcyjnych.
  • Nadzór nad realizacją krótkoterminowych planów produkcyjnych.
  • Bieżąca aktualizacji planu produkcji z uwzględnieniem nowych zamówień oraz ofert.
  • Potwierdzanie terminów realizacji zamówień produkcyjnych w uzgodnieniu z Działem Obsługi Klienta.
  • Bieżący monitoring, kontrola realizacji planu produkcji i stanu zapotrzebowań materiałowych.
  • Analiza zdolności produkcyjnych i optymalizacja procesu.
  • Dbałość o wydajność i efektywność produkcji.
  • Bieżąca współpraca z działem zaopatrzenia, logistyki oraz produkcji.
  • Uczestnictwo we wdrażaniu usprawnień oraz nowych projektów.
  • Miesięczne monitorowanie ustalonych wskaźników.

    • Twoje kompetencje
  • Wykształcenie wyższe.
  • Dobra znajomość języka angielskiego umożliwiająca swobodną komunikację.
  • Co najmniej dwuletnie doświadczenie w pracy na podobnym stanowisku w firmie o profilu produkcyjnym.
  • Mile widziana znajomość systemu SAP lub Simio.
  • Biegła znajomość MS Office, w szczególności MS Project oraz Excel.
  • Umiejętność pracy w zespole i pod presją czasu.
  • Umiejętność ustalania priorytetów.
  • Samodzielność, odpowiedzialność, myślenie analityczne.

    • Więcej o nas
    Wnieś swoje własne poczucie dumy i celu, pomagając nam rozwijać Czwartą Rewolucję Przemysłową – tworząc zrównoważoną przyszłość naszej planety i Twojej kariery. Dołącz do ABB i wykorzystaj siłę naszej zróżnicowanej globalnej sieci, współpracując i ucząc się od naszych światowej klasy zespołów. Przede wszystkim stawiaj sobie wyzwanie każdego dnia. Napiszmy przyszłość razem.

    To wyjątkowy moment na dołączenie do ABB Power Grids. ABB i Hitachi podpisały porozumienie o utworzeniu spółki joint venture (JV). Chcemy stać się nowym światowym liderem w sektorze energetyki dzięki wykorzystaniu mocnych stron obu firm. ABB Power Grids i Hitachi to w sumie 230 lat tradycji i doświadczenia na rynku. Razem będziemy w stanie kształtować przyszłość energetyki za pomocą pionierskich technologii i staniemy się preferowanym partnerem w budowaniu mocniejszej, bardziej inteligentnej i ekologicznej sieci energetycznej. Proces tworzenia jednej spółki ma zostać zakończony w pierwszej połowie 2020 roku, po otrzymaniu wymaganych zezwoleń. Przyłącz się do tej pasjonującej podróży.

    Oferujemy:

  • Ciekawą pracę w zakładzie nastawionym na innowacyjne rozwiązania i nowoczesne technologie.
  • Możliwość rozwoju i podnoszenia kwalifikacji zawodowych.
  • Pakiet benefitów pozapłacowych.
  • Miła atmosferę i partnerskie stosunki w pracy.

    • Talent Partner prowadzący rekrutację: Natalia Gierach.

    Osoby zainteresowane prosimy o przesyłanie CV za pośrednictwem naszej strony klikając na przycisk „Aplikuj”.

    Zastrzegamy sobie prawo odpowiedzi wyłącznie na wybrane oferty.

    Wszystkie oferty powinny zawierać klauzulę:

    „Wyrażam zgodę na przetwarzanie moich danych osobowych w celu rekrutacji zgodnie z art. 6 ust. 1 lit. a Rozporządzenia Parlamentu Europejskiego i Rady (UE) 2016/679 z dnia 27 kwietnia 2016 r. w sprawie ochrony osób fizycznych w związku z przetwarzaniem danych osobowych i w sprawie swobodnego przepływu takich danych oraz uchylenia dyrektywy 95/46/WE (ogólne rozporządzenie o ochronie danych)”.
    „Wyrażam również zgodę na przetwarzanie moich danych osobowych w celu prowadzenia przyszłych rekrutacji”.
    Transformers

Job Posting Description

In this role, you have the opportunity to

Implement and improve the Sales Support Process objectives and the day-to-day management of the sales support process ensuring the consistent supply of high-quality services.

You are responsible for

  • Managing incoming customer orders (systems, options and upgrades), overseeing and coordinating the process to complete and correct the order information until the order is ready to be booked.
  • Pro-active collaboration with the account managers, project managers, product managers and other stakeholders until the cases are completed and prepared for further processing in the supply chain
  • Ensure that all parts of a customer orders (from factories and 3rd party suppliers) are correctly listed on the order
  • Collect missing information from the specialists in the sales organization
  • Pro-actively communicate to customers internal in a clear and customer-centric way
  • Pro-actively providing support in resolving problems, escalating if required to the responsible manager
  • Ensure timely hand-over of the cases to order management according to the agreed policy
  • Provide support with further standardizing and documenting the way of working within the sales support team
  • Actively support with the implementation of continuous improvement, eg LEAN tools such as Kaizen/A3

You are a part of

Our Global Competence Center in Łódź, where we centralize our transactional processes. We bring together supporting roles within HR, Finance, Procurement, Customer Service, Supply Chain and other, enabling you to have a career in an international, cross functional environment. Your future colleagues speak 25+ languages and represent 15+ different nationalities, supporting our operations in 50 countries on a daily basis.

The team based in Lodz is responsible for providing support for the sales team.

To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience

  • Graduate with Bachelor or Master degree
  • Fluent English is a must (both verbal and written)
  • Working in matrix organization experience preferred
  • Ability to inspire commitment, communicate and influence virtually
  • Strong influencing skills; convincing power
  • Very good communication skills and customer attitude
  • Self-driven and pro-active, able to work independently in a virtual environment
  • Developed analytical thinking skills with an eye for detail
  • Computer literacy essential and experience in MS office applications

In return, we offer you

The unique combination of a critical and challenging role and a creative and empowering office environment. You will be actively encouraged to make improvements, establish best in class service and have a direct impact on the success of Philips on a daily basis.

  • Annual bonus based on performance achieved
  • Private medical care with option to extend it to family members
  • Benefit System cards
  • Discount for Philips’ products
  • Language courses
  • Relocation package applicable for people moving in from outside of Łódź region
  • Promotion of healthy lifestyle in the office (fruits twice / week in the office, gym, massage chairs, various events)

Why should you join Philips?

Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watching this video.

To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there,you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.

Twoje obowiązki
  • Uzgodnienia techniczne z klientami.
  • Przygotowywanie projektów elektrycznych części aktywnych transformatorów mocy (optymalizacja, obliczenia zwarciowe, cieplne, dielektryczne).
  • Ocena i minimalizacja ryzyk technicznych związanych z realizacją projektów.
  • Przygotowywanie zapotrzebowań na materiały potrzebne w procesie produkcji.
  • Wykonywanie dokumentacji konstrukcyjnej.
  • Nadzór nad transformatorem podczas jego produkcji.

    • Twoje kompetencje
  • Wykształcenie wyższe, preferowani będą absolwenci Wydziałów Elektrycznych.
  • Umiejętność wykonywania obliczeń wytrzymałości układów izolacyjnych z wykorzystaniem Metody Elementów Skończonych.
  • Umiejętność obsługi programów CAD, znajomość PTC Creo Parametric będzie dodatkowym atutem.
  • Znajomość języka angielskiego umożliwiająca swobodną komunikację.
  • Umiejętność pracy w zespole oraz dobra organizacja pracy własnej.
  • Umiejętność rozwiązywania problemów, zdolność do podejmowania decyzji.
  • Odporność na stres. Umiejętność podejmowania inicjatywy. Komunikatywność.
  • Gotowość do współpracy w środowisku międzynarodowym.
  • Preferowane będą osoby z doświadczeniem w projektowaniu.

whole_unnormalized_body:
In this role, you have the opportunity to

The Project Manager will initiate, lead and implement projects for internal Philips Partners (Business, Market, Function). These projects focus on the development of new capabilities, implementation of strategic initiatives and improvement of existing operational processes.

Projects are lead through structural approach, using standard methodology and best practices approach to ensure the seamless and effective integration of new products, services and applications.

You are responsible for

  • Responsible for gaining agreements on project objectives, balancing schedule, cost, quality and requirements.
  • Ensuring effective project realization.
  • Manages the scope and requirements. Manages the internal and external stakeholders.
  • Manages the business case and is a business partner focused on maximization of the added value for the business.
  • Manages projects ensuring execution is in line with project guidelines and directives using standard E2E approach
  • Determines project risks, defines corrective action and drives the projects to closure.
  • Determines, allocates, and directs all project resources in accordance with guidelines
  • Ensure compliance to Philips standard processes applicable for the project
  • Responsible to report on the status of the project to the project governance bodies and ensure transparency
  • Manages changes to the cost, time and scope of the project through formal change control processes
  • Ensure continuous communication with all key stakeholders of the project and share the required information as per communication plan
  • Formulates E2E project plan, in accordance with the goals and timing, set by management; specifies the manning of the project, resources required, anticipated costs, risk assessment and quality standards to be used
  • Controls the project budget and project progress, evaluates all project initiatives as to feasibility, costs/benefits and added value, takes corrective actions when necessary and generates adequate reporting
  • Reports on project team performance to the hierarchical superior of the particular member or the purpose of appraisal and makes proposals for trainings
  • Manages conflict and drive team collaboration to achieve project results
  • Fosters excellent cross functional communications and integrates the work of multiple stakeholders to achieve business objectives
  • Responsible to manage 3rd party suppliers involved in the project

Key Performance Indicators:

  • Project on time delivery

    • Project outputs delivered according to project charter
    • TG's sign off on time
  • Project quality

    • Project lead using standard methodology based on assessment
    • Customer Satisfaction (NPS)
  • Project in budget delivery

You are a part of

Jobholder is reporting to PMO Lead in the GBS Hub in Lodz. Job holder has no direct reports

To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience

  • Master's degree, or equivalent
  • Has > 5 years of relevant working experience, including experience in successfully managing various projects
  • Be strong at structuring complex tasks and coordination of complex processes
  • Good influencing and relationship building skills
  • Change management skills
  • Good process and data analytical skills
  • Being able to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a pressurized environment and work proactively to ensure project milestones are met
  • PMP certificate (or equivalent) will be a strong asset
  • Lean experience will be an asset
  • Excellent command of English (both verbal and written)

In return, we offer you

The unique combination of a critical and challenging role and a creative and empowering office environment. You will be actively encouraged to make improvements, establish best in class service and have a direct impact on the success of Philips on a daily basis.

  • Annual bonus based on performance achieved
  • Private medical care with option to extend it to family members
  • Benefit System cards
  • Discount for Philips’ products
  • Language courses
  • Relocation package applicable for people moving in from outside of Łódź region
  • Promotion of healthy lifestyle in the office (fruits twice / week in the office, gym, massage chairs, various events)

Join ABB and work in a team that is dedicated to creating a future where innovative digital technologies allow greater access to cleaner energy.

We are an international pioneering technology leader that is writing the future of industrial digitalization. One of our key ambitions is to get faster and leaner, and to move closer to the customer. Therefore, we are building up a Center of Expertise which in addition to Finance Business Partners and GBS Finance is one of the three key pillars of our service delivery model. The Finance Controlling & Planning CoE has the responsibility, working closely with the division and country organizations to: # Drive Controlling & Planning standardization. To strengthen our CoE team, we are looking for a self-driven Senior Specialist with a process improvement approach. Seize this unique opportunity to take an active part in shaping our new CoE center and grow together with the rapidly developing organization.


Your Responsibilities

As a Controlling & Planning Senior Specialist, you will be responsible for the following:

Business Analysis:
  • Perform analysis of business performance versus budget and forecast and benchmarking of key performance indicators with external and internal peers
  • Work with the other financial professionals in Divisions / Regions / Countries and functions to understand and analyze the drivers of financial performance and identify trends
  • Prepare various financial analysis (eg. cost / benefit analysis, inventories and NWC, overhead under / over absorption, Product / Customer profitability)
Financial reporting:
  • Support preparation of relevant organization financial reporting, business planning, budgeting and forecasting and validate accuracy of financial data and business information and reports by performing reconciliation and review of exceptions
Information and communication:
  • Provide information to management by assembling and summarizing data, preparing reports, presentation of findings and analysis
Optimization:
  • Optimize own performance to increase productivity, recommend changes of process standards and procedures, identify areas for process / report standardization
Internal control and documentation:
  • Ensure processes and controls within own area of responsibility are designed and implemented in line with Group and unit requirements
  • Maintain proper audit trail and documentation, ensure SOPs are prepared and updated, ensure service delivery of the team is within the agreed SLAs and KPIs

Your background
  • Minimum 5 years of experience in Controlling and/or FP&A
  • Bachelor Degree in Finance and Accounting or Business administration.
  • Understanding of end-to-end process, systems and data flows across organization at business and finance-side and proficiency in IT systems: ERP, Planning & Reporting tools and integrated solutions.
  • Good communication skills and ability to interact with Process stakeholders at various levels.
  • Good problem solving, analytical skills, ability to prioritize tasks.
  • Demonstrated ability to achieve objectives; focus on details, structured.
  • Strong MS Office skills.
  • Fluent in English.

More About Us
Your benefits:
  • Enjoy a stable employment in a company with a long history in innovation and technology
  • Collaborate with experienced experts in an international environment
  • Seize individual development and training opportunities, from job specific to soft skills
  • Get private medical care (including offers for family members) and life insurance
  • Receive attractive remuneration based on your experience and skills, and other financial benefits, such as annual bonus and internal share purchase program
  • Choose from various benefits in kind, ranging from healthy lifestyle offerings, to knowledge sharing, to teambuilding activities
Apply now for this job and become our next Controlling & Planning Senior Specialist

Important, please include in your CV the following passage:

“I hereby give consent for my personal data included in my application to be processed for the purposes of the recruitment process under the Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation)”.

“I also consent to processing of my personal data for the purposes of any future recruitment processes”.
Corporate Function Global Finance Operations

We are looking for a Junior Process Officer to join rapidly growing Nordea Finance Department.

This is great opportunity to become a member of highly skilled team, collaborate with our stakeholders in the international finance industry and increase your knowledge within the Banking sector.

If you want to be involved in variety of tasks/projects providing effciency for various business areas which create Nordea Future Banking industry, join us!

At Nordea, we see that the world is changing fast – and we want to be one step ahead of the curve. That’s why we’re deeply committed to providing the financial solutions of tomorrow to our customers. We’re creating an agile environment where we experiment and grow together – and we need your ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll be in good company with a chance to make your mark on something bigger.

About This Opportunity

Nordea Finance is a separate legal entity within Nordea group.It provides our customers with solutions that finance their investments. Through products like leasing, hire purchase, factoring and consumer credits, Nordea Finance enables improvement of customers’ cash flow, costs saving and increase of sales.

What You’ll Be Doing
  • Ensuring sustainability of the processes and deliver in respect of agreed service level.
  • Actively gaining process knowledge to provide required service level
  • Handling routine tasks at the required level of quality and within timeframe by following guidelines/work procedures

  • Representing the unit professionally in order to create good Nordea reputation
  • Working within Scandinavian environment

The role is based in Łódź

Who You Are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.

As a return we offer work in a friendly environment, social, sport and medical benefits and much more!

This is great opportunity to become a member of highly skilled team, collaborate with our stakeholders in the international finance industry and increase your knowledge within the Banking sector.

If you want to be involved in variety of tasks/projects providing effciency for various business areas which create Nordea Future Banking industry, join us!

At Nordea, we see that the world is changing fast – and we want to be one step ahead of the curve. That’s why we’re deeply committed to providing the financial solutions of tomorrow to our customers. We’re creating an agile environment where we experiment and grow together – and we need your ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll be in good company with a chance to make your mark on something bigger.

whole_unnormalized_body:
Join ABB and work in a team that is dedicated to creating a future where innovative digital technologies allow greater access to cleaner energy.

We are currently looking for a Mechanical Design Engineer to be a part of our design team. This role will be based in Lodz, Poland. We are looking for experienced engineers with preferably 2 years+ experience in transformer design.


Your Responsibilities
  • 3D modelling and creating technical drawings of mechanical parts for transformers.
  • Preparation of technical documentation and implementation of material bills for the production system.
  • Identification of any problems or errors in the design system and to work with the system engineer to correct.
  • Engaging with factory for any problems with the designs.
  • Prepare reports and related documents in accordance with internal and external requirements.
  • Work closely with the senior design engineers and implement design development rules in ABB software.
  • Provide timely mechanical engineering support to Engineering dept. (& other depts. as required) for day to day operation.
  • Support in root cause and corrective action for errors in the design system.

Your background
  • Bachelor’s degree in an Engineering-oriented discipline.
  • 2+ years of professional experience working with transformers preferably or in another design related environment.
  • Experience of working in a transformer design environment will be considered as an advantage.
  • Strong proficiency working with Creo CAD tools.
  • Recent experience with performing 3D modeling, 2D mechanical designs, sheet metal modeling.
  • Working knowledge of programming concepts is an advantage.
  • Strong English language skills is a requirement.
  • Strong attitude for using basic computer applications (e.g. MS-Office).
  • Ability to travel internationally.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Ability to work in a team.

More About Us
Bring your very own sense of pride and purpose as you help us drive forward the Fourth Industrial Revolution – creating a sustainable future for our planet, and your career. Join ABB and harness the power of our diverse global network, as you collaborate with and learn from our world-class teams. Above all, challenge yourself every day. Let’s write the future, together.

It is an exciting time to join ABB Power Grids. ABB and Hitachi have signed an agreement to create a joint venture (JV). By combining ABB Power Grids’ with Hitachi’s complementary strengths, we plan to form a new and stronger global leader in the power sector. ABB Power Grids and Hitachi will have more than 230 years of combined heritage and experience. Together, we will be well-positioned to shape the future of energy, with pioneering technologies, as the partner of choice for enabling a stronger, smarter and greener grid. The transaction is expected to be completed by the first half of 2020, subject to regulatory approvals. Join us on this exciting journey.

We offer:
  • An interesting job in a company promoting innovative and modern technologies.
  • Opportunity for professional development in an international environment and for increasing your abilities and skills in various areas.
  • Employment in a stable company with an established position in the market.
  • Attractive salary based on your professional experience and skills.
  • Good working environment.
To apply for the position, please send your application via our page.

We reserve the right to answer only to the chosen candidates.

We kindly ask you to include in the Curriculum Vitae the following passage:

“I hereby give consent for my personal data included in my application to be processed for the purposes of the recruitment process under the Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation)”.

“I also consent to processing of my personal data for the purposes of any future recruitment processes”.

position: VIENNA HOUSE ANDEL’S ŁÓDŹ: Kierownik Zmiany Recepcji (K/M)
whole_unnormalized_body:
stabilne warunki zatrudnienia, dofinasowanie do karty Multisport, noc w Hotelu w ramach szkolenia, zajęcia z trenerem personalnym, comiesięczne aktywności z ZFŚS, dofinasowanie do urlopu, obiady pracownicze. My pokażemy Ci jak serwować wysoką jakość, zarazimy pasją do hotelarstwa, damy Ci możliwości kontynuacji swoją kariery zawodowej. Zaproponujemy Ci czas pracy w zależności od Twoich potrzeb i dostarczymy wiedzę, która może zmienić Twoje dalsze życie. Jesteśmy dobrzy w wielu rzeczach, ale jeszcze nie we wszystkim. Dlatego zawsze poszukujemy tych, którzy przejmują inicjatywę i zaskakują swoim zaangażowaniem, umiejętnościami i talentem. Jeśli to ogłoszenie Cię zainteresowało, prześlij swoje CV. Kierownik Zmiany Recepcji (k/m) Front Office Shiftleader Jeżeli lubisz i chcesz Zapewniać wysoką jakość usług hotelowych poprzez rozmowę, obsługę recepcyjną oraz dążenie do realizacji potrzeb naszych gości; Być odpowiedzialnym za przebieg zmiany recepcji, wspierać i organizować pracę podległego personelu oraz sporządzać niezbędną dokumentację; Wdrażać usprawnienia w obszarze obsługi recepcji oraz tworzyć atmosferę współpracy i wsparcia wśród podległego zespołu; I wyróżnia Cię doświadczenie na podobnym stanowisku, umiejętność delegowania zadań oraz motywowania zespołu; pasja do hotelarstwa oraz chęć rozwoju w tym obszarze; bardzo dobra znajomość języka angielskiego i programów recepcyjnych; to jesteś osobą, której szukamy w VIENNA HOUSE Andel’s Łódź Hotel Vienna House Andel’s Lodz robi wrażenie pod każdym względem – wyróżnia się zabytkową fasadą z czerwonej cegły oraz doskonałą lokalizacją. Obiekt mieści się w budynku dawnego zakładu tkackiego na terenie Manufaktury, największego w mieście centrum handlowo-usługowo-rozrywkowego. Unikalną architekturę hotelu cechuje umiejętne połączenie kolorów i formy, designu i materiałów, ciepła i gościnności.
